author: {'steamid': '76561197961017515', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1422037156}
review:
This cannot be classified as a ship simulator at all. Not even close. Waste of money.
I bought it when it was released in 2016 with a hope that it would improve over the few next months/years - It did not! Now in 2024... Gave it another go... Not recommended at all. Spend your money on VSTEP Ship Simulator instead, thats a ship simulator that works...

review: Buona realizzazione e grafica di questo simulatore navale. Semplice ed intuitivo. Buono l'editor di Missioni anch'esso di semplice utilizzo. Le mappe di gioco sono ben realizzate ma in misura esigua e riguardante pochissime localit√† portuali del Mediterraneo Europeo (Gibilterra e Marsiglia) e nessun porto dell'Italia, Spagna o Grecia. Basterebbe offrire la possibilit√† di realizzazione delle mappe agli utenti per poterle poi inserire nel gioco come MOD o DLC. Le attivit√† di traghettamento non impegnano alcuna manovra specifica di caricamento e scaricamento veicoli e nessuna animazione √® attiva in tal senso. Nel complesso un buon gioco ma che pur avendo possibilit√† enormi di espansione non sfrutta appieno tali auspici

author: {'steamid': '76561198022043667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1665790575}
review:
Look, I like it. 
Been searching for a good ship sim for years that looked good, ran well and offered variety. This is it.
It is not Call of Duty XXI. And it does not bill itself as such. This title got some bad press. After my time in, and being one who actually drives real boats and wanted a title like this, I can say it is WELL worth the SALE price.

Yes, it seems to be abandonware. Um, 2016 reality people, there was a scamdemic between them and us today too, so.....

Also, No, I do not know of better ship sim titles than this currently out.

Look, I have been playing games since before there were VIDEO games. 
So, with that said, and not being today's inexperience figitspinner addicted type that contributes nothing, has zero life experience and has nothing to offer but criticism against those that actually get up every day and 'DO' things, I can totally appreciate this title. People worked hard on it and it does show, for those that are looking. Many types today cannot see things like this for the same reason a thief cannot find a cop ever, they are not looking for one.... Thinking types will get that.

Regardless, It does what it says. Worth it. Will paly here and there for years.

Also, in real life, most boats are slow. Waves are rolling and choppy. Pretty close ---FOR A GAME --- because that is what it is.

If you are one who expects a million dollar training simulator, then smarten up and go invest your life and savings into taking courses with the real things somewhere. It ain't on Steam. Period.

But, if you want a FUN little versatile ship sim game that you can even MAKE YOU OWN MISSIONS with, then this is it. ESPECIALLY for the $ale Price of around $10 USD.

As for the rest of the bad press I see here, all I can see when I read them is spoildness, need for attention, absurd expectations of million dollar training sims for $20 on Steam, unappreciative types that were raised on COD cutscenes and demand such payoff for 1/50 the investment in such titles. Types that just do not know better and never will.

Me?, Me think good stuff. 
If you don't, then who cares? Who really freaking cares?
Not me.
And don't forget you are special. Just like everybody else in the world ever was. Bored now.

	[td]It took me 10¬Ω to finish the whole set of missions. Because of the score I'm going to give it, I'd say that there's no replay value and once you've done the game's set of missions, you can create your own missions, but it's honestly not worth going again.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b]üíµ Is it worth buying? [/b] [/td]
	[td]No. I'd say not even on a discount. I got this game for free, but I'd not bother buying this game or playing it unless you're here to hunt achievements. [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b]üéÆ Steam Deck Compatibility[/b] [/td]
	[td]I‚Äôve tested this game for the simple purpose of this review. The game runs smoothly, but I do recommend running it through Proton GE for a much smoother experience. At my first lunch, the controls were jankey, but after restarting the controls went smoothly. It‚Äôs easy to control and works well. [/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][h3]üßæ Verdict: Terrible[/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2761784706] Rating Chart Here[/url] 
[/td]
	[td]European Ship Simulator has sadly taken one of the lowest scores that I've ever given. I honestly didn't feel much enjoyment from this game, but rather a painful experience, filled with waiting, wasted time and pulling hair. I can't recommend this game, even if you'd play it for free.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

European Ship Simulator is a naval ship simulator, that teaches players how to navigate a few variation of ships in different scenarios.

[h3] ‚öî Gameplay: [/h3]
Rate: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

The who gameplay for this game is a set of tasks and scenarios that you're faced in, where you're given simple controls, to accelerate, steer left or right and hook onto other ships, and then pull them to whatever objective mark you're told to do. The game is rather a walking simulator, but instead you sail.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2850799474

[h3] üòÑ Fun: [/h3]
Rate: ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

Except a speed boat, that keeps the driving a bit more interesting, but overall, the game is rather slow, and boring to play. I can't say I've had fun or tried to learn to control the boat from the inside of the ship, as looking from a outside of the ship was easier to kinda get an idea where I am and where I want to go.

[h3] üèû Visuals: [/h3]
Rate: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

Visually this game is not too bad, but it doesn't appear to wow me at all. Ship design is nice, but it doesn't go over board to create a nice world. It rather feels shallow and empty. There's no NPCs to see in this world and when you're sailing the ship you can't even see yourself as captain.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2850799545

[h3] üîä Sound: [/h3]
Rate: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

Music isn't memorable and sound is rather poor and empty.

[h3] üìñ Story: [/h3]
Rate: N/A

The game has a set of missions, but they don't act at all as quests or story.

[h3] üßµ Length: [/h3]

‚òëÔ∏è  Short
üî≤ Average
üî≤ Long 
üî≤ Unlimited

Honestly, if this game moved a lot quicker and controls were a lot tighter, it would be a lot shorter. 10 hours is a lot to consider.

[h3] üß© Difficulty: [/h3]

‚òëÔ∏è Easy
‚òëÔ∏è Normal
üî≤ Hard
üî≤ Brutally Hard
üî≤ Impossible

Some missions presented a bit of maneuverability difficulty, but not enough to get frustrated with. Overall the game is rather easy.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2850799619

[h3] ‚≠ïConclusion: [/h3]
European Ship Simulator fails to deliver an interesting, fun and great ship simulation experience. Filled with bugs, crashes periodically and without reason, I find it difficult to recommend this game to anybody.

If you're looking for a deep and interesting ship simulation experience its best you look elsewhere.

review:
Das Spiel ist gar nicht so √ºbel, wie ich erst dachte. Man f√§hrt viele Arten von Schiffen und hat eine Reihe von Aufgaben. Vom Schlepper bis Hochseekreuzfahrtschiff, alles dabei. Grafik ist auch sch√∂n.
Leider hat man nur Einzel-Missionen (und davon eine Menge), man sieht aber keinen Fortschritt (au√üer die Errungenschaften). D.h., man kann jede Mission jederzeit ausw√§hlen.
Au√üerdem ist das Speichersystem sehr spartanisch. Man kann jederzeit speichern ABER dadurch verl√§sst man das Spiel. Dann tr√ºbt noch ein dummer Absturzbug bei 2 oder 3Missionen das Spiel. In diesen Missionen hei√üt es dann, speichern, speichern...
Zu guter letzt funktioniert die Zeitrafferfunktion so gut wie gar nicht. D.h., man f√§hrt einige Zeit geradeaus und kann sonst nichts machen.
Daf√ºr gibt es einen Tag-/Nachtzyklus und (statische) Wettereffekte und eine nette Wellensimulation.
Dennoch eine Empfehlung, da es Simulationsfans durchaus gefallen k√∂nnte und es sehr chillig und sch√∂n ist.

review: Worth the price of admission for the ferry and cruise ship missions alone. The cruise ship mission is more like a puzzle than a simulator, as you try to manoeuvre a behemoth ship around the port while avoiding other traffic. Bring patience, brown trousers, and a whole lot of quicksaves. It's a challenge, and it takes an hour or so, but you'll get there in the end.

Glad I didn't pay much for it. Got it as part of a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118155180', 'num_games_owned': 1036, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1645233738}
review:
Der beste Schiffssimulator, den ich je gespielt habe! Nicht alle Missionen sind daf√ºr gemacht, insbesondere Dover-Calais ist ohne den Schnellvorlauf sehr eint√∂nig. Die meiste Zeit befindet man sich nur auf dem Wasser (welches gro√üartig in Szene gesetzt wird, vor allem im Sturm) und Verkehr gibt es auch kaum, zudem f√§hrt man dann auch fast nur geradeaus. Herausforderungen bestehen jedoch in der Hafennavigation sowie beim Anlegen von gro√üen Schiffen. Die Schiffe sind in ihrer Tr√§gheit hervorragend umgesetzt, auch wenn man sich vielleicht mehr Details h√§tte w√ºnschen k√∂nnen. Die Gr√∂√üenverh√§ltnisse zu der √ºbrigen Landschaft, die sehr karg gestaltet ist, stimmen nicht immer, vor allem wenn das Fischerboot gr√∂√üer ist als manche H√§user. Das Drumherum gilt es also zu vernachl√§ssigen, ansonsten hat man einen guten Simulator, wenn man Schiffe mag.

Es kann vorkommen, dass das Bild einfriert, das Spiel jedoch trotzdem weiterl√§uft. Dann einfach raus- und wieder ins Spiel reintabben, das erspart einigen Frust.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079853514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1671027472}
review:
ESS is a perfect match on my backup PC, using fully compatible O.S W-7/64 Pro.
Setting the graphics to medium works best on my rig.

The red, green, and yellow arrows for mission progress and accomplishments, must be reached very accurately.
Good thing about them (arrows), is that they can be seen from far away via orbit view, or in walk mode on deck/wheelhouse.
During docking, very low speeds must be applied for finishing task in target area.
Patience and precision must be employed.
Tip: When operating the large cargo ship in tight quarters, it is best to use only one bow thruster at a time. The one closest to the right throttle handle.
Using both thrusters is best for docking.

Ships during storms have detailed windshield wipers, but no manual control.
Must specify that they do not work on the tug boat. 
The windows (in tug) are full of grime and you can not see clearly through them.
Reflector and navigational lights are handy in darkness and stormy seas.
Lighthouses with their revolving beacons, are a very nice touch.
There is no water depth indicator.

Controller/Gamepad is operational, such as on my proven wired Logitech F310 (X Box Type).
No crash on desk top at all.
No game freeze's either.
Some occasional 20-25 FPS in certain views and operations, but does not become a slide show.
Still runs smooth at those low rates.

Again, very recommended for marine entertainment and water physics.

I have been a long time fan of all VSTEP's ship/boating software, ever since ship simulator 2008, and more recently on S.S.E (Ship Simulator Extremes).

So long fellow Mariners.

PS: Beware, Windows 10 is [not] mentioned in the system requirements.

review:
No idea what the controls do! No tutorial / help for controls. Complete guess work.
Ship is damaged too easily and will sink after a minor scrape (which happens a lot when you don't know what the buttons do!)
Controlling of ships is complex, and you have no guide on how to learn to improve, you're just thrown into the deep end without armbands!
Basically it's a poorly executed sim

author: {'steamid': '76561198012473463', 'num_games_owned': 4077, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1592580337}
review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]
European Ship Simulator is an awful simulation game that manages to have no redeeming qualities at all. The graphics are probably the highlight of the game, and they are mediocre at best. As for gameplay, it is clunky and tedious. Controlling your ship isn't fun because the user interface is so awkward to use. Most mechanics aren't explained at all, so you wind up just guessing what you are supposed to do. A game like Euro Truck Simulator gives you plenty of guidance, which helps ease you into the game. There are also a number of bugs, specifically with the ship AI that just goes on predefined routes and pretends like the player isn't there. Everything also takes a very long time, even with fast forward, so you spend large portions of the game (80-90%) just sitting there watching your ship move. Not recommended at all, truly one of the worst games you could buy, especially at $20.

1/10
[quote]
Visit our [url=https://www.mmmreviews.com]website[/url] for more in-depth reviews and recommendations
[/quote]

review:
Molto bello e rilassante

Io lo consiglierei, perch√® come ho gi√† detto √® divertente, rilassante, e puoi anche fare missioni personalizzate!
Avendo un ottimo pc posso dire che non ho riscontrato nessun problema, il gioco va fluidissimo.
Per√≤ vorrei che si possano guidare gli Smith Houston e gli Oriente (traghetti ro-ro da carico per mezzi gommati).
Io non capisco chi lo giudica male, perch√® dai, ha delle grafiche ottime e se avete un ottimo pc non lagga a nessuno.
Anche a me prima laggava, ma ho aggiunto ram e adesso non lagga pi√π. In poche parole, il gioco √® bello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154425859', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1565464925}
review:
[h1]My Heart Drowned in a Sinking Ship[/h1]
June 12, 2015 - Purchased game through Steam for 5.99
Played a bit, utterly disappointed, uninstalled game.

April 25, 2019 - Reinstalled game, gave it a run to look for improvement. 

Seriously! 
This game is the exact same as when it was in early access. 
Still disappointed. 

So, I sank a bunch of ships just to watch the water seep in. 
Raised my number of achievements from 1 to 9???

Looked for some guides. Found nothing about how to actually make the boats move faster. 
(Ok, so the motorboat moves at a good rate.) 
Realized no one has been here since 2015. 

Hello...hello.... hello....o....ooo!
[Echoing silence as reviewer exits the empty room.]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1540477170}
review:
It's easy to be mislead into believing European Ship Simulator is a high quality simulator from the screenshots, as the graphics are quite decent for this game.   Unfortunately the reality is quite different.   The game was developed deliberately to make it seem like it was produced by the Euro Truck Sim and Warehouse Logistics simulator producers, but it isn't.   What happened was the developers did a kickstarter/early access pitch, and instead of fully developing the game, they dropped development almost immediately once they got the money and moved on to a new project.

As a result the game is very, very lacking, the controls are terribly done and very unintuitive.   There's only a handful of missions... when Euro Truck Sim has more depth than your game, it's probably a strong warning sign. 

But in this specific example it's apparent the developers here have acted deliberately and with bad faith to fleece gamers.

Under no circumstances should anyone pay $20 for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038262958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1632401551}
review:
Schiff-Simulationen gibt¬¥s schon einige Jahre, viele eher mittelm√§√üig. Ich selbst habe 2006 mit einem von Astragon angefangen, war ganz okay.
√úber die Jahre kamen immer mal wieder welche raus, die mich aber nicht so ganz √ºberzeugten.

Der European Ship Simulator (ESS) hat zwar auf Steam negative Kritik, nach einigen Videos auf YouTube wollte ich es aber trotzdem mal wagen.

Gleich vorneweg: Eine Vollkatastrophe ist das Spiel nicht!

Der Spieler bekommt eine Handvoll Schiffe und einige H√§fen zum Befahren. Das ist f√ºr eine solche Art Spiel durchaus gen√ºgend. Bei dem Preis kann man halt keine endlosen Ozeane und 500 Kutter erwarten. F√ºr jeden sollte da was bei sei.

Zudem liegt dem Spiel ein Missionseditor bei, mit dem man sich schnell kleine Auftr√§ge erstellen kann. Dieser ist recht umfangreich, so lassen sich Tageszeit, Wetter und co. auch via Trigger √§ndern. Egal ob eine Reihe an Wegpunkten, die man abfahren muss oder eine F√§hr√ºberfahrt, mit wenigen Klicks sind gute Ergebnisse m√∂glich.

Ebenfalls l√∂blich: Der Spieler kann direkt in der 3D-Ansicht die Steuerung √ºbernehmen, ist also nicht zwangsl√§ufig auf Tastaturbefehle angewiesen. Der Zugang zum Spiel ist auch recht einfach.
Die 3D-Steuerst√§nde sehen auch gut aus, es sind hier und da kleine Details, ansonsten sind die Br√ºcken menschenleer.

Im direkten Vergleich zu Ship Sim Extremes, welches in meinen Augen aktuell die einzige Alternative hierzu ist, wirken die Schiffe detaillierter, wenngleich der Umfang hier geringer ist.
Das Fahrverhalten unterscheidet sich dabei doch recht stark, da die Schiffe hier im Spiel deutlich schneller an Fahrt verlieren.

Allerdings gibt¬¥s auch einige Schattenseiten:
Es gibt keinen Tastenbefehl, um Steuerungen zur√ºckzusetzen. Da es recht wenig Feedback au√üerhalb des HUD gibt, ist es schwierig herauszufinden, wie die Steuerung jetzt eingestellt ist. Dies ist in der Au√üenansicht samt Overlay zwar ersichtlich, f√ºr einen Simulator, der NICHT in Au√üenansicht bedient werden will, ist dies leider sehr d√ºrftig.
Grafik-Optionen ingame fallen sehr mau aus. Au√üer 3 Qualit√§tsstufen kann man n√§mlich nichts ver√§ndern. F√ºr mich ist das zu wenig!

F√ºr wen ist dieses Spiel also geeignet und ist es ein besseres Spiel, als Ship Sim Extremes?

Jeder, der diese Art Spiel mag, kann hier Spa√ü haben, keine Frage, ob es besser als Extremes ist, kann man gar nicht richtig sagen. Vom Umfang her hat der betagte Ship Sim Extremes ganz klar die Nase vorn! Mehr Schiffe, H√§fen und M√∂glichkeiten, wie z.B. den wechsel der Umgebung via Script. Daf√ºr ist der Editor auch viel komplexer und schwieriger. 
ESS hingegen kann mit einer zeitgem√§√üen Grafik und Zug√§nglichkeit punkten.

Beide Spiele haben ihre Daseinsberechtigung, wer ein Fan von Schiffen ist und viel um dieses Thema erleben will, aber Abstriche bei der Grafik machen kann, ist beim Ship Sim Extremes besser aufgehoben.
Wer jedoch eher auf die Optik baut und einen vern√ºnftigen Umfang sucht, ist bei ESS an der richtigen Adresse

author: {'steamid': '76561198116137604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1525176302}
review: Very good graphics. Controls are easy to learn. Manouvering the bigger cargo ships is a challenge. Need patience but otherwise a great simulation game. AI is terible in this game however. They seem to just follow pre-defined paths and do not react to your on-coming ship. If you do not avoid, they will crash into you if that is their pre-defined route. You have to anticipate the AI's every move, so be slow where you need to, not that ships go at a fast pace. This is worth buying compared to the more modern version "World Ship Simulator"! The later is absolutely rubbish compared to this version!

author: {'steamid': '76561198415678429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1503797945}
review:
Bought yesterday, hard to load.  Can't get any sound.

As a one time professional seaman tried the mission most familiar with, Bulk Carrier into Gibralter, something I have actually done on multiple occassions.  The whole scenario is rubbish, a bulk carrier with two engines and azipods at that, (I doubt there is one of those in the world) and I presume that the "bow engine" means a bow thruster, <0.1% of bulk carriers have those.  And only one tug?  Fair enough lets make it difficult BUT one tug with no way to give it orders?  And no mooring lines, so the obvious , and cheaper, no tug fee, way to leave the berth is not available.

The controls using keyboard keys is so JetFighter 1980s, there should be a wheel & telegraph, or better voice recognition & spoken commands.

OK I only paid $4.99 for this BUT I was gyped, this is total rubbish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052504352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1500512575}
review:
I wanted to enjoy this game but I found many flaws. Missions seem to go on forever, Turning is derpy in the speed boat and other issues. I mean a tiny fishing boat ran into the side of my cruise ship and my ship went down and he stayed afloat. I enjoy the aspect of a boat simulator but these mission last for around 30-40 mins of just going in a straight line. The speed boat's turning is crazy where 1 degree with make it go in circles. 

Overall I'd Give it a 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068298228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1593010462}
review:
Probably the most boring game in the world, but in I way I like that. There's not much to do, but at least you can sit back and relax, especially when commanding big cruise ships, ferries, etc. The game has excellent graphics and the water looks visully stunning, especially when you are out in the middle of the ocean and high up on the bridge. You can walk around the bridge on larger ships and see the scenery from every angle. Graphic quality inside the bridge is excellent. The controls are good as they offer precise steering on the ships. Game runs absolutley perfectly on my PC and I have never had any crashes. I also get a fantastic frame rate. I also love the 'swell' effect at the boats sway on the waves. Port Control speak to you and keep you updated on what you have to do which is great. Sounds are spot on, including engine sounds and cab switches/controls.
Overall, I think is a great game and a must-have for any simulation gamer. Try to get it when it is on sale as then it is better value.
Overall, I give it 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138213224', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1493211371}
review:
[h1]European Ship Simulator[/h1]

[b][i]"Um "simulador" de navios que n√£o exerce sua fun√ß√£o. Sem personalidade e mon√≥tono, ESS n√£o √© um jogo empolgante e falha em sua proposta do come√ßo ao fim."[/i][/b]

Vamos conhecer - ou tentar entender - um pouco do European Ship Simulator (ESS) que mais parece um mod do World Ship Simulator (WSS) ([url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/pannana/recommended/403980]An√°lise aqui[/url]) ou seria o contr√°rio? Curiosamente √† empresa que distribui o jogo brasileiro WSS √© a que desenvolveu o ESS - Excalibur Games - O mais interessante de tudo √© ver como os erros n√£o s√≥ se repetem, como pioram em alguns aspectos. Vamos l√°.

√â not√≥rio o reaproveitamento de ambas as desenvolvedoras na quest√£o da textura, onde praticamente n√£o existe diferen√ßa entre o WSS e o ESS, mas √© incr√≠vel ver como o European roda numa taxa de quadros inferior, mesmo nas mais baixas configura√ß√µes gr√°ficas, deixando o jogo travado/lento e mesmo num computador com melhores configura√ß√µes a jogabilidade se manteve p√©ssima. O jogo possui poucas caracter√≠sticas pr√≥prias, e das que importam o √∫nico ‚Äúpr√≥‚Äù √© possuir editor de miss√µes, fora isso o game se demonstrou um verdadeiro desastre. As embarca√ß√£o s√£o diferentes do WSS e seus interiores tamb√©m mas isso era o m√≠nimo que a empresa tinha que trabalhar...

O fato de n√£o possuir um modo hist√≥ria faz dele um jogo r√°pido j√° que voc√™ pode escolher qual miss√£o quer fazer, transformando o que deveria ser simulador em um jogo arcade que n√£o possui metade das fun√ß√µes que deveria. √Ä falta de recursos aliado monotonia que o jogo apresenta fazem dele um game totalmente desinteressante, j√° que at√© suas miss√µes s√£o muito pouco desenvolvidas.

ESS deixou o beta praticamente no mesmo momento que o World Ship Simulator, demonstrando que havia um trabalho conjunto - ou seria s√≥ uma coincid√™ncia? - at√© mesmo na quest√£o de valores ambos tem o mesmo pre√ßo, sendo que as mudan√ßas que citei nesta an√°lise n√£o justificam existir dois jogos, o que muda de um para outro s√£o apenas os cen√°rios e as caracter√≠sticas das embarca√ß√µes, o resto √© tudo igual; texturas, sons, miss√µes ‚Äúid√™nticas‚Äù. O trabalho da equipe brasileira foi muito melhor e mesmo assim n√£o o suficiente para salvar o projeto.

European Ship Simulator √© um desastre do come√ßo ao fim, por√©m √† desenvolvedora segue trabalhando e talvez melhore no decorrer dos pr√≥ximos meses j√° que em janeiro um desenvolvedor postou algumas novidades que devem chegar no futuro‚Ä¶ Enfim, por todas as quest√µes citadas ao longo da an√°lise eu n√£o recomendo sua compra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357964704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1554074850}
review: To be honest European Ship Simulator was quite a nice game. After 2 days of enjoying the game I stopped playing. It just got boring. European Ship Simulator is not really a "free world" game. The game also only offers missions so you must follow the orders the game tells you to do or else there's no point into playing. The graphics are great on  all of the ships which was probably the only good thing about the game. This game is should not be a final release and to be fair with the editors and developers of this game, please don't release something thats INCOMPLETE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025154215', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1677953488}
review: Ich habe dieses Spiel im Angebot gekauft. Da war pl√∂tzlich auch noch der "World Ship Simulator" dabei, welcher von den Einstellungen her besser zu konfigurieren ist. Ich war froh, da√ü beide Spiele f√ºr den Mac angeboten werden, doch der "European Ship Simulator" ist nur eine Mogelpackung. Da wird immer auf den Mac geschimpft, da√ü dessen Grafikkarte viel zu schwach w√§re. Es verwundert aber nicht, wenn die Spiele nicht f√ºr den Mac entwickelt werden, sondern es werden einfach nur die Windowsspiele in eine Laufzeitumgebung gesteckt, die auf dem Mac arbeitet. Der Computer mu√ü also erst Windows emulieren und darin dann noch das Spiel. Da√ü das an der Leistung nagt, liegt auf der Hand. Bei diesem Spiel ist es √§hnlich. Da wird auch noch Unity eingesetzt, was auch eine Performancebremse ist. Wenn ich das selbe Spiel auf dem selben Mac unter Bootcamp laufen lasse, kann ich es in h√∂chster Aufl√∂sung ruckelfrei spielen, obwohl die selbe Grafikkarte benutzt wird. Die Grafik ist in Ordnung. Das Wasser ist sch√∂n animiert. Leider gibt es Grafikfehler, wie z.B., da√ü das Wasser durch den Schiffsboden schwappt. Ansonsten ist das Spielgeschehen lahm. Nat√ºrlich ist es eine Simulation und kein Rennspiel, aber es k√∂nnte durchaus eine Zeitrafferfunktion enthalten sein, damit man nicht minutenlang von Punkt A nach Punkt B fahren mu√ü. Auch mu√ü man nur mit dem Schiff ganz leicht irgendwo anecken und schon geht es mit Mann und Maus unter. Leider gibt es keine anderen Figuren in dieser Spielwelt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998348465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1485898621}
review:
PROS:
+ You can control different types of civilian vessels, from small tugboats to huge cruise liners
+ You can walk around your ship in first-person mode
+ A wide variety of missions are available
+ A mission editor is included so you can design your own routes and objectives

CONS:
- Options menu is bare bones (three non-descript settings for graphics and an audio slider that controls both sound and music at the same time)
- Graphics are on the low end and except for the odd suicidal AI-controlled ship, the entire world seems lifeless
- Music is incredibly annoying
- Physics and handling of ships feels a little off
- No freeplay or sandbox mode, just scripted missions (unless you use the mission editor)
- The mission editor is overly complex and very unintuitive
- AI-controlled ships won't adjust their course, so if you happen to be in the way (even if this means you're simply docked), they will ram you
- Crashes to the desktop so often it's unlikely you'll ever play through an entire mission without losing all of your progress at least once

VERDICT: As much as I wanted to like ESS, I just couldn't. Even if I could forgive some of this game's faults, the constant crashes and restrictive gameplay are just too much. Unless you find this game as part of a package deal (on Humble Bundle, for instance) or at an extremely low price, I'd have to say "No, don't buy this game."

review: This game is EXTREMELY worse compared to older ship simulator games. I bought this out of the screenshots, but today I made the mistake of forgeting to look at the reviews due to my "sugar rush" of browseing games. This is the first game I ended up buying without looking at reviews. I am really disapointed from a variety of resons. First, some parts of the game aren't finished. Second, there is no free mode/roam. Third, the cameras are really bad. Compareing to Ship Simulator Extremes, there is no walking aroung the ship, just the bridge, camera angles are limited, and the HUD is werid. I do not recommend this game. If you want a good ship simulator game, just don't buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064388679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1511220124}
review:
[h1]Update Nov 21, 2017: TL;DR[/h1]
Ryzen 7 1700 CPU average utilization >98% (8 cores 16 threads maxed 100% most of the time). Radeon GPU RX-470 4GB avg utilization <10%. Note that most of the time, GPU is running at 0%. Conclusion - DO NOT BUY! if you're using AMD GPU. The above stats are typical regardless of what resolution and graphic detail you select. Incidentally there are only 3 settings in-game; low, medium and high. Resolution can only be set at the launcher wih Alt-click of the play button in Steam.

I'm changing recommendation to an emphatic NO because i'm tired of games pretending to support AMD GPU hardware acceleration when in reality it's more akin to software acceleration because frame rates of below 20 fps is just not acceptable by any standards!

[h1]Correction June 15, 2017 0210 hrs[/h1]
My bad, I'm now unsure that poor frame rates is due to under-utilization of AMD GPU because of a simple fact; other dissimilar games that out-performs on equivalent specs also exhibit under-utilization of AMD GPU. So this might just be a case of poor general optimization.

[h1][u]Update June 13, 2017...[/u][/h1]

It now seems apparent that the low frame rates is due to under-utilization of GPU and unrealistic minimum system requirements - i3, seriously i3? More on this later. ESS is heavily dependent on CPU processing. Nearly 2 years ago i played this on i7-2630 QM laptop with Radeon HD 6770m 1 GB GDDR5. Playing and recording gave absymal frame rates that frequently fall below 30fps. The game world is very large and feature many 3D objects and some ship like the container ship is humongous! It's the reason why i couldn't complete the first mission (actually 12th in the list of missions) that involve this ship. It would crash at random points, usually while changing camera views and sometimes crashed for no apparent reason. My guess is the GPU ran out of memory even though system RAM was more than adequate. 

A few days ago i fired it up on my new Ryzen desktop and monitored vital system stats b4, during and after playing and i found out that this games utilized all 8 cores and 16 threads up to 100% nearly all the time while the Radeon RX-470 GPU was at 0% half the time. So the i3 minimum spec is misleading; this game would probably use as many cores and threads as is available to the max! Although the memory requirements didn't seem to scale-up. 

It's apparent that this game doesn't make full use of AMD GPU evidenced in the fact of low percentage utilization and the fact that basic feature like Anti-Aliasing is purposefully ignored. Why? Because even when i set the AMD Crimson driver to use 4x AA, the game would pretend that AA feature doesn't even exist!!! WTF even games in the 90s already use AA. This is totally unacceptable; i dunno how this game treats Nvidia GPU but [b]Radeon GPU users should stay away from this slow as molasses ship simulator that turns a blind eye to even a basic AMD GPU feature set unless you have a server class CPU and can live with jagged edges.[/b]

Take at look at this proof; mission #14 can only reasonably run at 720p and never reach 60fps. Frame rates fluctuates wildly and averages IMO slightly above 30fps. 
https://youtu.be/__aMDZfFWbc

Tried to run previous mission #13 in Full-HD and i got occasionally 30 fps, more often @24 fps 
 while GPU was still being under-utilized.
http://dai.ly/x5q09xz

Score amended: 3/10 for AMD GPU users (not recommended); ?/10 for Nvidia GPU users (who knows?). This website claims that it can run at 200+fps on GTX 970: http://www.game-debate.com/games/index.php?g_id=20958&game=European%20Ship%20Simulator
Well who knows? Clearly something is very wrong somewhere. Well at least it makes full use of Ryzen CPU unlike Dirt Rally which refused to run on more than 4 cores.
[h1][u]...End of Update[/u][/h1]

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[list]
[*]Looks better than World Ship Simulator
[*]Has Steam Achievements
[*]Missions can be entered and exited at anytime, skipped or start any missions at will.
[*]Bridge views very detailed and there's room to walkabout.
[*]Sufficient different types of camera views which are practical and facilitate gameplay.
[*]Water waves and reflections look amazing!
[*]Sufficient engine controls to turn and pivot a large ship.
[*]Player controlled ships movement and inertia seems accurate enough though ship to water interaction seems to be only approximation.
[*] Possibly due to the game being glitchy, laggy and buggy, missions' success conditions are greatly simplified; mooring need no ropes to be tied to pylons, hull damage won't cause gradual sinking. Critical crash at port reducing hull to zero still considered mission success. Possibly due to hull being too fragile to begin with hence win conditions are extremely easy.
[*] Time skip allows fast travel to vicinity of destination port but can only be triggered at a single small area en route. Miss that and it will be a long arduous journey.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[list]
[*]Runs poorly, worse than WSS but this is partly due to my potato chips notebook PC
[*]Menu text glitches and gives garbage when go into settings in full-screen mode
[*]The Continue function only works in mid mission, never after completion of mission
[*]Because of the above, no real continuity and therefore no career mode
[*]Mission based, no free-roam or sand-box mode
[*]NPC ships runs on script, no randomization nor AI therefore scenarios play exactly the same way. [b][i]Correction: NPC ships do have AI and stop, this is obvious in smaller ships, big ships on the other hand take too long to reverse brake hence it looks as if they don't wanna stop.[/i][/b]
[*] Player ship too fragile, e.g Bulk Carrier gently touched tug boat, hull drop to 37%
[*]Bridge view locked - literally locked doors everywhere.
[*]Clipping issues between ship and sea but this is common in any game.
[*]Graphics quality settings makes little difference in frame rates or visual quality, only the water waves look different and there's only 3 basic setting; low, medium and high
[/list]

[b]Verdict[/b] - You may want to consider getting it in a bundle if you like these sort of basic task based (non technical) real world simulators (non-fiction or fantasy). 

5/10 due to poor optimization and glitches. Why 5? because this is a niche market. 

Recommendation: Yes if you can tolerate glitches and poor performance. No if you expect a polished product. Since there is no maybe, i give it a thumbs-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031071288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1468508752}
review: do not buy this if you want a ship simulator, it is not what it says on the tin, passenger ferry expected to make right angle turn 50 yards from a sandy beach ( what captain or pilot of a multi million pound vessel would get that close in reality ) way point passed over to find next point is 200 yards away and at a right angle  with the passage between 3 fishing boats  (Dover ferries make moves like this everyday ) fishing boats that expect  larger vessels to alter course to avoid collision, games that end when the unavoidable collision occurs this game has it all in spades, no radar, limited waypoints (one at a time ) no instruments, no mini map just a small square box with a arrow on top of a ship like  shape, this needs serious development before it even approaches the description that sold it to me, it is really a poor shadow of what it should have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256285317', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1601885240}
review:
This looks promising! You can see there's been a lot of thought and detail put in so far. You can control your ship via keyboard or just using the mouse to handle the levers and switches yourself. Being able to walk around the bridge is awesome too. You get a nice sense of scale when captaining a large ferry that I really enjoy. 
You're currently limited to 3 missions, which is understandable given it's Early Access, each with a different boat and in different conditions. Involving both Dover and Calais. I take this route a lot and can say attention has been made towards the skylines of both these towns and ports, which again is a nice touch. 
You can even sink the ship and stand on the bridge as you witness the area filling with water, if that's something you're into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021856147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1466262693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198281263776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 11479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4342, 'last_played': 1679149905}
review:
I tried to help this poor game with a good review before, but I can't anymore. I'm sick of the lack of many tools and actual SENSE in this "simulator". How come there are no tugs to assist large vessels? And why do I have to stop when the other vessel is at fault and purposefully came into my way and make me sink? This is too robotic and unrealistic.
Save your money and don't try it, folks, especially if you're a merchant mariner...forget it. Stick to the simulators that they will provide you in your academy. European Ship Simulator is bad and I no longer recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002328923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1465341645}
review:
An excellent ship simulator (if that is what you are into).  However, the game could have been so much more, but a dispute during development spoiled all that.  I had no trouble installing or playing the game.  I have decent frame rates on the highest settings and have not had a crash as of yet.

Pros:  The graphics are very good and easily on par with FSX and are more like Silent Service 5.  The bridges are very nicely done indeed and remind me of some of the addon planes cockpits that I have for FSX.  Highly detailed, large in some cases and very nicely executed.  The exterior orbit camera mode is very nice too and the ships look very good.  I am not a sailor, but the player ships do seem to move very well and are not overly responsive.  There are even seaguls flying around the ports.

Cons:  No freeroam mode with missions only.  There are not a lot of missions either, but there is step by step guide on the Steam Forum to teach you how to create your own missions.  I could not find any downloadable missions, addons or mods on the internet.  You are locked into the bridge and cannot wander about the ships (fair enough - you are stuck in the cockpit in FSX as well).  There is no career mode or campaign.  The water within the ports should be far calmer than the outside sea.  That is the whole point of the water break haven walls!  The water break on the bows of the ships is static and stays in place even when the bow is lifting up out of the sea on the crest of a wave.  It does not move with the level of the sea.  There are no other crew members or people to be seen, nor is there any radio traffic, so it is a bit lonely and quiet.  There is no full world out there (hence no free roam), just some routes built in to enable travel to and from specific ports only.  The other AI ships have a ridiculously amazing ability to turn on the spot at speed.  Not very realistic to watch a large container carrier turning on a sixpence like a jet-ski.  There are far too many controls, buttons and screens in the bridge which do not work and are not interactive.  Lastly, the Time Jump button is only active for a short time.  If you do not use it in time, you will have to do the entire voyage in real time!

Conclusion:  This game by graphics is streets ahead of it's intended successor 'World Ship Simulator' which looks very childish and rudimentary by comparison to this game.  The fact is, this game could have been so much more.  The day will come when someone finally makes a ship simulator along the lines of FSX and X-Plane.  This game could have a full world out there, with more controls working in the bridge.  It could have been done in such a way that other developers get involved with building addon ports, ships with fully working bridges, interactive port communications as per FSX, etc and giving some of the take to this games developers.  Just as we have with FSX.  A missed opportunity there.  I have Ship Simulator 2008 which is let down by it's old graphics and I also have the early access 'World Ship Simulator'.  So far, European Ship Simulator knocks the socks of those in terms of beauty and bridge detail.  For it's current price of ¬£5 ($7.50) on sale at time of writing, it is well worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007652326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1478800032}
review:
It is called a simulator, but it is not. This is a genuin arcade game. You just can steer the boat and dock. You can not set a course, you can not navigate (the most important activity onboard IRL!) you just have to leave the port, go to the point on the map (that isn't a seamap!!!!) and done!
A proper simulator would let you set a course on a real seamap, calculate the time of arrival, calculate the need of fuel, fill your fuel tanks, check the engines, maintain the engines, make repairs if the boat is damaged, communicate with a radio to the port and other vessals... I can keep going on but you know what i mean.
I've noticed that a lot of games call themselves "simulator" but only a few are...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991892231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1464051258}
review: Many have slagged this game off for being "too slow" or lacking gameplay, some say it is boring. I have helmed ships big and small in real life and have to say that the reactions to engine and helm are spot on. This is the best shipping simulator I have been on. Graphics are brilliant, plenty of single player missions and the ability to build your own missions as well. The 3d enviroment within the bridge of each ship is stunning, and controls whilst simplistic, are sufficient for anyone. The introductory mission of tug and tow, is quite accurate, and the final "nesting" of the  cargo freighter into its assigned berth is testing but fun using both towing skills, knowing when to drop the tow, and final pushing along the hull to adjust freighters position. In real terms, these jobs on full size vessels must be done slowly and with care to avoid accident or damage, this is reflected in what you do here. For a fun game simulator, I was a bit dubious about purchasing at firest, but now I am glad that I got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017530435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1569500122}
review:
Simulationsspiele sind meine absoluten Lieblingsspiele. Und gerne bediene ich mich sehr realitischen Simulationen. Dass ein Schiffssimulator in dieser Preisklasse keine Simulation mit allem Drum und Dran, also eigentst√§ndige Navigation etc. bietet, sollte klar sein. Nur habe ich dieses Spiel von den Erwartungen her mit den bisherigen Schiffssimulationen gleichgestellt und wurde herb entt√§uscht. Die Steuerung ist schwer zu bedienen, eine direkte Nullstellung einer einzelnen Steuerung nicht m√∂glich. Des Weiteren habe ich bisher keine M√∂glichkeit gefunden, die Br√ºcke mit der "Ich"-Perspektive zu verlassen. Des weiteren funktioniert die Steuerung des Schiffes in der "Ich"-Perspektive nicht. Somit ist es weder m√∂glich, das Schiff zu erkunden noch in dieser Pespektive an die Reling zu gelangen, um ein genaues und fachgerechtes Andocken vom Schiff heraus vorzunehmen.
Die CI-Schiffe scheren sich indes √ºberhaupt nicht um den Verkehr des eigenen Schiffes und fahren grunds√§tzlich auf Kollision, wenn man ihnen nicht rechtzeitig weicht. Wie soll denn da ein 180 ¬∞-Man√∂ver im Hafen gelingen?

N√§chster Punkt, der mir bisher aufgefallen ist: Das Kreuzfahrtschiff hat zwei Antriebe, die sich 360 ¬∞ drehen lassen. In der Simulation ist maximal 10 ¬∞ m√∂glich.

Aus meiner Sicht daher absolut keine Empfehlung f√ºr dieses Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049504115', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1448317820}
review:
I actually liked this Game and the progress it was making in Development [of course it had it's problems in many aspects]. However, this isn't a Negative Review for how the Game is, but European Ship Simulator was a Project that came to a complete halt and all Development stopped. 

Once the Project was dispanded, the Developers stated that a new Sim "World Ship Simulator" is in the making and everyone who bought European Ship Simulator gets it for free, which they did live up to, and we do own the new one. However... This Game stayed on the Market and everyone who bought it up until the 24th of November would still recieve World Ship Simulator for free.

It is now the 26th of Novemeber, 2 days after the Deal ran out, and I am absolutely disgusted that the Developers are now continueing to sell a Game that wasn't finished, and is no longer under Developement...

An absolute disgrace to the Gaming world... This Game needs to be taken OFF the Market completely.

The publisher found a new Dev team for the game, they now have World Ship Simulator in the Store. They've given it to all users of this game for free.   

But I didn't buy an archaic looking arcade game, I bought a nice looking ship simulator.     

My refund is on it's way.    

This is the thanks I get for supporting this game in the early stages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007649342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1446470502}
review:
Although graphics are good, controlling ship with generic joystick is difficult: keyboard remains in qwerty, joystick and peddals together cannot be handled by the game... these controllers issues I did not expect from a game trying to be AAA.

Missions are sometimes buggy, also the released to xbox  I believe it was (play console) just to get in more money without fixing the bugs. 
Although I must say that graphics are well done, but just as one say "wow", controller issues and bugs ruin it. Also long time when I see an update or fix being released.

I do not therefore recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198039408804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1444278841}
review:
Terrible!!!!! And thats putting it nicely! Lets review.....

Start game
Drive Super Cargo Container! (sounds awesome!)
Throttle forward!.........
wait......
wait......
wait.....(10 minutes pass) 
Made it to the way point! Time to turn!
Turn 4.0` starboard.......
wait......
wait,.....
wait......(5 minutes pass)
0.0` lets go forward again!
Lets push buttons while we wait.
nope
nope
doesn't work
nope
nope
all for show....
Lets go walk around the deck! That'll be fun!!!!
nope, doors locked.
nope this doors locked too
nope, windows locked.
hrmmm...
Lets talk to my extensive crew for this Super Carrier!
nope
nope
none
no one...
hrmm.... still waiting for my next waypoint
(Goes outside to smoke, 10 minutes)
odd.... still moving to waypoint...
19000RPMs and moving like a slug....
-=Quit=-

The fishing, tug and speed boat were all the same.


-=Uninstall=-

Don't waste your money, you'd be better off throwing in the garbage. Seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071911454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1435283880}
review:
Not impressed... constant crashes to desktop, always before I can even get out of port.  Check the forums... people experiencing CTD on a consistent basis.  The publisher seems to think this "game" is ready for delivery, but it isn't close, and should still be considered beta.  I actually had fewer issues during early access.
Mr Publisher said "When claims over the game being ‚Äúunfinished‚Äù arise, I can imagine that you are expecting more content than has been delivered."  Well, Mr. Publisher, my first guess would be, their claims are referring to the constant crashing... not more content, necessarily.    Purchase at your own risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168783583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1690764876}
review: HORRIBLE,so clunky! I drive ships for a living and obviously I dont expect much out of a PC simulator but this thing is garbage! Crappy interface, crappy controls. Couldnt even configure the controls! Keep your money and dont buy this junk!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010826219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1505297913}
review:
Although I enjoy shiping of all kinds, this game has nohing to do with any form of proper seamenship. The AI is completely unintelligent, and a better name for the game could have been "Demolition Derby on Water"!! Towing ships back to port is just laughable, and one ship I was towing looked very mugh like it was riding a very rocky seabed, with punctures in all 4 tyres!!

Not recommended for the "unintelligence" and "non quality assurance"!

review: I own the real ship simulator. One where the mass of the ship is actually taken into account. or what the water is really doing versus just being able to perfectly turn a ship. author: {'steamid': '76561198139329099', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1431173448}
review:
[h1]‚ÄúSube a bordo y disfruta del viaje. 7.2/10‚Äú[/h1]

Ya que estamos hablando de un simulador en toda regla es de esperarse el realismo, por lo que si has venido aqu√≠ esperando intensas competencias a bordo de un bote de carreras o comandar un portaaviones en mitad de la guerra est√°s en el lugar equivocado.

Uno de los primeros aspectos que llamaron mi atenci√≥n sobre el juego fue la facilidad para controlar el barco, trat√°ndose de un simulador era de esperarse tener a mi alcance total control sobre cada aspecto del barco, algo que fue totalmente satisfactorio ya que lo permite con cualquiera de los 8 botes disponibles.

A pesar de tratarse de un titulo que intentar emular a la perfecci√≥n la experiencia de navegar un barco en ning√∫n momento me ha parecido especialmente dif√≠cil. Aunque carece de un tutorial apropiado que muestre la utilizaci√≥n de los controles he terminado averigu√°ndolo por mi mismo.

A primera vista el aspecto gr√°fico de European Ship Simulator destaca de inmediato, su excelente calidad y dise√±o realista del agua hacen notar la calidad en su dise√±o, cada barco goza de un dise√±o pulido y detallado hasta lo m√°s m√≠nimo. Aunque muy por detr√°s de ello tambi√©n se esconden un par de errores, que a pesar que ya mencion√© arriba aqu√≠ tambi√©n son aplicables. Me refiero a los efectos clim√°ticos que el juego presenta, que aunque se miran bastante bonitos parecen ser mera decoraci√≥n, ya que su presencia no afecta el movimiento del agua o el bote en ning√∫n momento.

[h1]Pros:[/h1] [list]
[*]Gr√°ficos y modelados de excelente calidad.
[*]Las mec√°nicas y controles son bastante f√°ciles.
[*]Efectos clim√°ticos realistas.
[*]Editor de Misiones. [/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1] [list]
[*]Carencia de tutorial o explicaci√≥n sobre los controles.
[*]A pesar de tener bastante contenido se siente como un juego ‚Äúincompleto‚Äù.
[*]Los efectos clim√°ticos son solo adorno. [/list]

[h1]Conclusi√≥n:[/h1]
European Ship Simulator es la clase de juego que todo fan de los simuladores disfruta, cuenta con excelentes mec√°nicas y un dise√±o destacada. Como juego se desarroll√≥ bastante bien desde su acceso anticipado, a pesar de las carencias que pueda presentar, en general lo encuentro como una experiencia disfrutable y bien trabajada, en un principio ve√≠a mucho potencial en European Ship Simulator, potencial que al final no aprovech√≥ correctamente.

[url=https://spoileverything.wordpress.com/2015/05/10/mini-review-european-ship-simulator/] An√°lisis completo en Spoil Everything [/url]

Este an√°lisis fue realizado con una copia del juego facilitada por el equipo de Excalibur Publishing.

review:
I love vessel simulation games and that is the reason why I tried this one in spite of the negative opinions i had read.... but i was disappointed.

This is not a real vessel simulator.

Controls inside cabin are bad... there is no indication or mention about the course you are heading. There is not havigation chart, sounding, bearings, radar, distance to ships, cpa data, the map is bad, etc, etc, etc....

it is more like driving a car than a ship in the water... there is not wind nor current effects, theres not wind indication and ship movements are not real.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058184444', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1453496684}
review:
As someone who bought this game during Early Access because of the typeface that reminded me of Euro Truck Simulator, I was disappointed to see it out of it in such an unfinished state. 

Graphics options are almost non-existant - you get to choose between low, medium and high quality, neither of which tell you what's changing; also, the game doesn't look that great and runs just as bad on either setting - CPU usage is all over the place, it's lacking content, it's unpolished, can't turn off the menu music, etc. 

These are issues that are normal in alpha/beta/Early Access games and usually I'm willing to turn a blind eye if the gameplay is good.

Early Access shouldn't be replaced with promises supporting the game in the future. When I bought it during Early Access, I knew what I was getting into. People buying the game now, however, may be unaware that the game is unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159426714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1444019545}
review:
This is a most enjoyable game, but there is some room for improvement. The graphics, especially of bridge interiors, are excellent. While I'm not an expert on ship physics, they seem pretty good. The learning curve for this game is not too steep, by and large, and after a couple of early failures, I have played about 75% of the missions and passed them all. However, the game does have one or two little bugs, and there are some areas where it could improve:

1) The text goes weird when you try to change the settings. It's OK initially, but when you go back a screen after making your desired change, it all gets screwed up somehow.

2) Ships seem rather too fragile. You can sink by hitting a pier at low speed! The level of damage needs to be more realistically adjusted.

3) The AI boats behave strangely at times. In the cruise liner mission for example, a boat that appeared to be going past me suddenly turned in a sharp circle right in front of me! They are also unrealistically indestructible - bump into one, and you'll sink, but it won't!

4) In the "berth the ferry in a severe storm" mission, the weather is actually perfectly calm!

5) As others have mentioned, there is no career or campaign mode. This would boost the game enormously, as currently there's not a lot left to do after you've played the missions (although you can supposedly make up your own, or edit existing ones, with the Mission Editor).

I also think the game could possibly benefit from time being sped up a little √† la Euro Truck Simulator, or maybe players could be given the choice between "real" time and "fast" time. Some missions kind of drag a bit, even when you're going at your boat's maximum speed. But these bugs and irritants notwithstanding, the game is generally good fun, which is why I recommend it overall. Also, it is a fairly new product that the developers are giving a lot of time to right now. Already since I bought it, there has been an update. So hopefully this promising game will soon be even better in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182288579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1661727092}
review:
I was a little bit apprehensive about the game, having read mixed reviews here.  Anyway I bit the bullet and am very pleased.  I have a fairly average PC, but it has still allowed me to crank the graphics right up.  Admittedly, there was some chop in early 'missions' immediately after installation, however, a full defrag and restart cured that.

I work in the commercial shipping industry, and quite enjoy this game.  As far as "simulation" goes, it is a nice simplified ship driving game without too much depth that I use to kill time.  Do not expect procedural realism, but you will get a genuine appreciation for the techniques required to move the included vessels around in their daily work.

If you are wondering about your PC specs, I have an AMD A10 processor, 8GB DDR3 and an ATI R9270 and it works perfectly with room for more.  The difference between the LOW and HIGH graphics options in-game isn't huge either so most modern PCs should run it with nice visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006929008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1424755380}
review: This game is, sadly, not even close to being what I would consider a finished game that's worth the asking price. As other reviewers have said, there is almost no actual game here to play. Essentially, every single "mission" is just "go from marker A to marker B. Done. Now go from marker B to marker C. etc." There is no real difference in playing the various ships (from a speedboat to a tanker vessel) other than their speed in getting from point A to point B. This game needs a lot more content, mainly in the form of context and rewards for getting from point A to point B, before it will be much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997355398', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1425650175}
review: Now the game is full release I am disappointed. Its not really a simulator and the missions are lacking details, and its boring with little replay value - Even completing a mission gives no rewards (its just misison over) or even a points or scoring system. Other ships have no AI and use predetermined parameters meaning they go the same way every time and physics between the different boats does not seem to change much (they all seem to turn too quickly). Its also far too easy to sink a ship by tapping a dock. Game optimization is awful with task manager showing it using 1.8GB RAM and 93% CPU (on a Core i5) taking my CPU to 100%. Judging by the other games the Developer has made (one where Speed Bumps was one of the major features of the game) I now get the impression they do not have the technical skill (or finances) to make this game have the basic features the community have been asking for (realistic physics, steering wheel support, in cockpit HUD, Maps), where this game is missing many basic features that were present in the last generation of Ship Simulators. I will however praise the dev for updates and being active in the games forums and replying to people (I wish all companies were like this), although more often than not the reply is negative, stating they are a small team with little finances and the feature will not be added. These days any kind of simulator is a massive undertaking as ETS2 has really raised the bar. I just get the feeling they are in a bit over their heads and a game like this is too ambitious for this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021354136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1424997411}
review:
I like the idea of the game but feel that it was a waste of money.

Positives:
Great idea
You can walk the bridge (albeit very slowly)

Negatives:
Glitches in graphics (water in boat, distorted edges, poor water effects)
No tutorial
No campaign mode
Other traffic does not give way properly ( boats randomly change paths and crash into yours, damaging boat and ending mission) In real life a fishing boat doesnt uncompramisingly sail into the side of a ferry, there is communication and giving way on both sides.....
No simulation speed increase so you can sail entire mission, if you use the option given to you, you just jump to the end for docking.

Don't waste your money is the bottom line, the game although finished is not in my opinion in a finished state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121703044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1430235419}
review:
Well this is just a Game and far away from a "Simulator". The Ship Physics are totally unrealistic, and a lot of People ( i included) told the Developers in the Forums, that some things a more then wrong, but they did not change it. One simple thing is, that the Engine from (i think it was the ferry) goes up to 4000 RPM, and that is totally unrealistic (the real Maximum of a single Marine Diesel is aprox. 650 RPM). The Speed must be shown of the propeller shaft and not such Fantasy Values like 4000 RPM. Then its funny, that you can drive the heavy Ships like a Car, and the Steering of a heavy weight Ship is like driving a Go-Cart. All this shows me, that the Developers never really invested Time to make some inquiries about the Physics and Basics of a real Ship. Also funny is the Cruise Ship, if you have 0% Power on the Engines, the Ship brakes immediately like a Car within a few Meters. Everybody who has a little bit physical appreciation knows, that you cant stop such a big and heavy Ship within a few Meters so easy.

Well positive is, that the Graphics are better as in SSE, and that they implemented some famous Ports in Europe, like Rotterdam, Hamburg and Rostock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088149823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1486591072}
review:
(please note that I decided to write this review is interspersed with comparisons between this Ship Simulator and the older Ship Simulator by Vstep)

Bit of a mixed bag this one, frankly not very impressed with it, espesially given that I myself am a sailor (though by no means a captain) with a little boat handling experience.
When compared to Vstep's long abandoned Ship Simulator series this one's got quite a lot of catching up to do, even though the Vstep shipsim has numerous faults of it's own.
First thing I noticed about this game that kind of set the trend for what I was expecting of it was the poor terminology used in the manual, for example referencing to the 'Front Engine' and 'Rear Engine Throttle' controls, the proper names for these being the Bow and Stern Thrusters.
As far as I can tell this game has only two features better than that of the Vstep shipsim. The first being the inclusion of independent control for port and starboard azimuth steering units, as found on the Tug, though unfortunely let down by the clear fact this game's developers obviously don't know exacly how these units work in real life. The second, possibly more obvious one, being the distinct lack of bugs which were a notorious problem with the Vstep simulator. As far as thing go thats about it for being ahead of it's (dormant) competition.
Where graphics are concerned this game isn't too bad, all things considered, it's fairly level with the Vstep one, though I would consider Vstep to be slightly ahead. So far I can't say I've found much in the way of issues with the physics, but I may be wrong. However there are a few things with the physics and general effects that could do with attention, such as for some reason the ships seem to create a bow wave when going astern (reversing), and one thing I found when I came along side the cargo ship in the first tug mission, I lightly brushed the side of the ship with the side of the tug, a move that would be fairly common place in reality, resulted in severe damage and caused me to sink. In reality the tug would be fitted with rubber fenders, as can actually be seen on it's sides in the game, which are there to dampen any very light brushes resulting in minimal damage, if any.
This game has a little more in the way of interactive/functional controls on the bridge, though frankly their functions being fairly unrealistic, such as light and horn switches. The horn seems to operate on a repeating pulse setting when turned on and won't stop until turned off again. Personally I think they missed a trick here as they could have opted for a selective horn signalling system as used on real ships, one-uping Vstep. The lighting is something they really put no though into as it only turns on a few deck lights, not the more obvious navigation lights.
The steering isn't that great, though thankfully is much better than the horrible control setup of Ship Simulator:  Maritime Search and Rescue. One rather nice touch with the controls is that both the throttle and steering are set so that they take time to complete their movments, as in real life, rather than just instand full rudder or power. The steering/rudder angle on the featured ships only goes up to 10 degrees in either direction, both poor and unrealistic as the typical maximum rudder angle for the average ship is 40-45 degrees, as reflected in the Vstep game. As I mentioned before, the developers of this game decided to include the use of azimuth steering units with certain vessels, as did Vstep, but unlike Vstep did have enough of a brainwave to program in individual steering control, but unfortunately They don't actually know how these units work, where as Vstep do. Just to clear up, an azimuth unit is effectively a pod fitted with a propeller mounted under the ship which can be rotated though 360 degrees thus eliminating the need for a rudder or reverse gear and giving the ship better agility than with a conventional rudder and fixed-shaft propeller setup.
Just like the Vstep shipsim, this on comes with a mission editor. At first it seems quite simple to use but I still haven't got the hang of it, so I suspect looks may be deceiving, also not really helped by the camera being in a fixed birds-eye-view, only the height above ground being ajustable. Good luck to anyone who can figure it out.

To sum it all up this game does have potential here, but I'm not convinced by it. The best thing the developers of this game could do is have a good long shot with Vsteps (now possibly abandoned or furgotten, jugging by their website) Ship Simulator series and see where this game has to improve. So I don't recommend this game, at least not yet.

Instead I recommend you try out one of the Ship Simulator series from Vstep, The newest one Ship Simulator Extremes (2009 release) being available on Steam, but be prepared for bugs/glitches which are likely to appear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116625974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1657884344}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971982540', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1424724121}
review:
If this wants to become a "Simulator", there are many things to improve.

Few hints for the developers:

- Missing lot of indications: wind direction and speed, speed and course over ground, speed trough water, bow and stern lateral speeds, rate of turn, etc.

- Controls are not convincing: on the ferry the rudder goes from 0¬∞ to 10¬∞. Impossible. Engines from 0 to 6000 rpm? That's a ship, not an airplane. On the cruise ship the pod controls works in the opposite way. It is impossible to set to zero the control with the mouse (a double click to reset the control would be great). On walktrough visual there are no controls: how is someone suppose to maneuvre the ship from the bridge wing, for example? Furthermore, bridge wings on almost all the big ships are unreachable, making impossible to see the ship's side for berthing.

- Physics and ship models are far from reality

- Wind doesn't have any effect on the ship (neither cog differente from hdg, nor turning tendency)

It's a shame.

Available if the developers will need any technical advice (i work as deck officer on board cruise ships).

author: {'steamid': '76561197981903121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1424766309}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984225782', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1424680663}
review:
First, European Ship Simulator was not created by the same development team that brought you Eurotruck Simulator. Arguably, there was an effort by the Euroboat team to make it appear that way. Unfortunately, with European Ship Simulator, what you get is a shallow experience at best without any campaign mode, meaningful objectives, or even a sense of immersion to say the least. 
 
I've completed 4 of the missions so far, successfully I might add, and it wasn't challenging at all. You have a short selection of "Missions" along side a mission editor. I started off with a tug boat mission. The tug boat itself was sufficiently detailed and breaking into open sea from the harbor was satisfying, the choppiness kicked up and there seemed to be correct current physics to deal with. That, unfortunately, was about all there was to be impressed by.  
 
Dropping the tug was a simple press-this-button, which displays a bunch of balloons around your boat. All I had to do was select one of my ballons, and click on the balloon from the ship I would be towing. This easy process connects the two balloons together with a rope, instantly. At this point I'm ready to tow. The massive tanker's front end would dip inappropriately into the sea while towing, which was weird. The physics aren't perfect but I can get passed it. There is no complicated mooring procedure either once you get to your destination. You simply float to the next arrow and you're done. Congratulations. *yawn* 
 
Later, I tried the speedboat. A speedboat mission! My objective was to drive my speedboat to a yacht and pick up a rich lady in distress. On my way, I clipped through just about every bit of ocean, I was practically a submarine. Additionally, the reaction of the boat to the choppy water felt so unauthentic that it made me feel like the developers included this irritation just to force me to press the A and D keys a whole bunch of times and not fall asleep. 
 
To spice things up, I tried the cruise liner. I figured, this should be a challenge. Wrong again, and that brings me to my conclusion. European Ship Simulator is a disaster at the price it is asking. I've played more complex and immersive sims on the iPad. I don't know how some people came the the conclusions they did by recommending this game, it really does make me wonder. The game offers you nothing in return for your effort. It is over-simplified, unrealistic and broken. Wait for the massive content update it needs and in the meantime there are better boating simulators out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993857397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1428516392}
review:
Dit spel is nog steeds in "early access", maar het potentieel is er. Het is speelbaar, maar er ontbreekt zoveel aan basics zowel grafisch als wat simulatie betreft.
Laat je niet misleiden door het logo. Dit heeft niets met Euro Truck Simulator 2 te maken. Er is geen career systeem, maar meer een Train Simulator achtig missie systeem. Helaas is de mogelijkheid om zelf missies te maken pas bij de officiele release uitgebracht, met het gevolg dat het aantal missies karig is. Er zit wel voor elk wat wils bij met soms hele pittige missies. Hopelijk dat dit in de toekomst beter wordt; voorlopig nog niet.
Grafisch is alles redelijk, maar niet vreselijk mooi. Vooral het gebrek aan AA is storend. Performance op laptops is iets waar elke simulatie tegen aanloopt en deze is geen uitzondering. Verder is alles zo steriel door het totaal gebrek aan omgevings aankleding. Logisch dat er op zee niet veel te beleven is, maar dat de havens geen autos, mensen, kranen, etc bevatten is ronduit bedroevend. De weergave van de kust van Dover is dan weer wel behoorlijk.
Verder heb je niet echt geweldige physics. Ok, de boot kan zinken, maar geen feedback met geluid en weergave. Alleen de melding dat je zinkt en een boot die langzaam volledig horizontaal zinkt.
Wel goed zijn de controls die per schip anders zijn, met echt een verschil in besturing en gedrag.
Conclusie: wacht met kopen totdat het spel verder is uitgewerkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023405379', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1424647268}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083301024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1461629392}
review:
This is a Simulator. It means you are no going to have sooo much excitement like killing everyone everytime. This is a civil maritime simulator. I mean, no races, no bombs, no torpedoes. You simply go from A to B safely, fast and without sinking the thing. Physics are good, Controls and maneuvers are as accurate a i can recall from 5 years living in front of Algeciras Port and seeing ships arriving and departing everyday. 

Maps are accurate or at leastAlgeciras/Ceuta/gibraltar, wich I know like the palm of my hand, sure it is. I could recognize easyly El Pargo (the sports and fishers port of Algeciras), Punta Paloma, Getares, El Rinconcillo, JuanCarlos I dock, the sports port near the runway al Gibraltar, CEPSA shipyard, Acelor, La l√≠nea, Palmones' river, city of Ceuta. 

No it has not 4k resolution graphics but maybe developoers must improve this area. And i miss several other things like more information in a HUD (how many knos i'm doing, heading following, wheater information like wind direction, the deep under my bow, mayby a sonar and a radar).

But despite this if you want to sali like a pro, no doubt, it worth the pricer.
