author: {'steamid': '76561198173161658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1608907519}
review:
This is an okay simulator with decent gameplay and fair graphics. It's a fair amount of fun if you're into this kind of nerdy stuff. The only concern I have right now is the fact that the devs have already fully released this game.

I bought this game while it was in Early Access because it seemed very promising. It's a decent simulator with devs that listened to input from the community. When I opened up Steam to see that this game had been released like I shat a brick. This game is in no way ready for release. I expected to put another few months of work into this game before releasing it. Right now, there is a minimalistic amount of content, and there are just way too many things that need to be polished. Seriously, it's currently an unfinished game. Until new content comes out and this game becomes a proper simulator, I would not really suggest you buy it unless you're so strapped with cash that you roll your joints with hundred dollar bills. I'm disappointed in the devs for releasing this game so premature, but seeing that they still have new content coming, maybe it's not so bad. 

DEVS CAN YOU FIX THE WAKE BEHIND BOATS BECAUSE RIGHT NOW IT LOOKS QUITE UGLY.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991020665', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1424824794}
review:
At this point, the game isn't really worth buying (I, unfortunately, can't get a refund.  But, maybe I can help you save a few hard earned dollars).

I have a decently beefy machine.  Not a monster computer, but a 6 core 4.2ghz machine with an AMD R9 200 series video card and 8gb of RAM.  It doesn't struggle with any games I play - except this one.  The frame rate is just horrid (sub 10fps).  And changing the video settings doesn't seem to do anything for me.

Additionally, the gameplay is, well... lame.  I absolutely love sim games (days of play time on ETS2), but this is a huge disappointment.  Other ships in the harbor will run right into you, even if you run your horn.  The controls are poorly implemented, in that you can't easily reset them to "0" by adjusting them left or right, as you do to increase the throttle.

I haven't played a ton so far, because it is frankly frustrating to play.  I was suckered in by the decent reviews that were likely posted with this being an "early access" game in mind.  Now that it is a real release, I can only call B.S. on this one.

Devs - feel free to credit my account for my $20.  I know you won't, but that'd be the right thing to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107608663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1429839178}
review: This game was not ready for release.  A couple glaring issues is the physics model.  When making quick S turns in a small boat, the boat will tip from side to side.  In this simulator the boat stays perfectly level which is highly unrealistic.  The other thing I noticed was a lack of options?  Where is the anti aliasing?  Turning it on via the Nvidia Control Panel doesn't seem to work for this game.   Now I'm not totally negative, I do like the selection of ships, and the models look very nice.  I also enjoy the ship traffic, and the weather modeling is very good.  So this game does definitly have some things going for it.  I hope it continues to be worked on and patched and more features added.  I really wish that it hadn't been released prematurely.  I don't understand the strategy of releasing it when it wasn't finished?

author: {'steamid': '76561197986365056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1424927104}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960538928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1432941141}
review:
This game is no way or shape ready to be considered a final release. I purchased the early access so that I could be part of the development process, which I was expecting to last 12-18 months. Here we are a month or two later and its considered "retail" ready. No, this is yet another embarrassment to the Early Access/Kickstarter way of doing things.

If you are looking for a "simulator" do not buy this. Anybody that considers this as a simulator doesn't know the meaning of the word as it has no simulator aspects to it.  I am very disappointed in the game, the developers and Steam for continuing to allow developers to release early access games that they have no intention of finishing and just want to make a quick buck. If the game remained in Early Access I wouldnt have an issue, but this is not a finished product.

Early Access and kickstarter products like this are legalised theft, that is all I have to say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037503751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1424792353}
review:
The release of this game is clearly premature. It will require at least an additional 500 man-hours to reach the status of what I would label a ‚Äúfinal release‚Äù. In every other industry, a company would lose a tremendous amount of money and market value if they would decide to put such a product on the market. 

Unfortunately the whole game industry seems to take the same path of laziness, which is why I cannot personally blame the developers of European Ship Simulator. 

Another thing, I understand the word ‚ÄúSimulator‚Äù as a software that tries to emulate reality as accurately as possible within technical feasibility. And by this definition that game does not even come close to a simulator. 
Maybe I will come back to that entry next year in the hope to see the positive changes, but as for now, I definitely not encourage other people to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970352122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1423982215}
review:
Navigating the ships requires some skills, but other than that there's not much fun to be had in this game (in its current form at least). Considering it's a simulation I expected a lot more realism and attention to detail. Now it's basically a "go from point A to B" kind of game and all-in-all everything feels very unrewarding. 

I was really hoping I would be able to navigate my ships through some rough waters, battling the waves and fighting with the forces of nature. But the water in this game is pretty static and the weather effects are (as far as I can tell) purely visual.

Graphically everything looks very unpolished. The bridge interiors and ships look okay, but other than that everything looks pretty bland and unfinished.  The UI is horrendous and handling the controls is very tricky. The graphic options are limited and not what you would expect from a current generation game (for example: no real-time shadows, no AA, low resolution reflections).

The developer has announced that this game will leave early access soon, which seems odd because there's still a lot of work to be done before it can leave the alpha stage. 
Definitely not worth the money at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964613396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1424622627}
review:
I'm not really sure why this is getting such rave reviews.
The graphics are OK, but not "breathtaking." Also, there is very little actual game here, even for an early access title. You have very constrained mission areas to play around in, no roaming the high seas. The largest area is a trip across the English Channel at night.
Also, the physics are somewhat suspect, as your boat cannot so much as touch anything else without sinking, no matter how gentle the inpact.
Another black mark is that the UI and menus are very unpolished, and very little exists in the way of tutorials. Even yourincoming radio messages are simply texts, with no voice acting. You truly feel alone in the world they are presenting.
Even though the game doesn't feel in the least bit like a finished game at this point, it is leaving early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030388429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1422679007}
review: Wow, what a fantastic ship simulator. I spent over 25 years as a marine radio officer in the merchant navy & this is about as real as it gets. Congratulations to the game developers. The morse code being send is perfect morse & says LEDU  wonder what that stands for? To the game developers, I would like to see a few people walking around the docks & onboard vessels. The thrusters should be marked BOW THRUSTER (left side) & STERN THRUSTER (right side thruster). Single thruster vessels should be marked BOW THRUSTER. Looking forward to the game developing further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093343197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1424191974}
review:
Bought this game today and im very dissepointed. it crashes every 15 minutes or so and you cant save the game. Only way to save is to quit and save, so every time you save you have to restart the game, and without saving every 3 minutes i cant complete a single mission because the game will crash randomly.
And then there are the graphics, Ship sim extremes is a old game now and has better graphics then this. 
building are outlines with details painted on it and the draw distance is poor.

I would be happy if i got my money back for this game. With the amount of content in this game they should call it a demo

author: {'steamid': '76561198119497243', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1421781210}
review:
ESS (European Ship Simulator) is a game where you have a list of missions that you can do. My personall favorite thing to do is sink a ship full of passengers. The game is pretty enjoyable at times, and can be fustrating when new to the controls. If a free roam/open world element were to be added where you could explore the open sea and own your own boat buisness and start by driving other peoples boats until you have enough money to buy your own and then you could hire others to work for you, and then when you get to a certain point in the game, just explore without the worry of losing money since your employees will be making you endless amounts of money. Or a Euro Truck Simulator but with boats. It's definitally worth a buy if your into boats and driving them.

TL;DR?
7/10, would sink again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090367178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1464396254}
review:
I bought this game the day after it came out. Said it was coming out in Augest but actuly came out in November, but toataly worth the wait. I have spent a lot of time getting use to at first, seeing that I crashed into the pier the first few times. Only three big suggestions I would make at this point. They are:

1.ADD A TUTORIAL! There is no real tutorial at the start, you are just expected to know how to play.
2.Add a free drive mode. Have a free drive mode were use can just drive a speedboat around or something.
3.Add controler support. I think it would probley be easier to controlif you were using a wheel or Xbox 360 controller.

Overall, I would highly recomend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198065611397', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1425452696}
review:
This Simulator has great potential, the Scenarios that are offered so far are sure to satisfy every taste, from a small Speedboat to a big Cruiseship. The level of detail is good, though i would wish for a more detailed bridge with more buttons and levers to use. 

Overall i think it is well worth the money, since you are supporting a Simulator that could easily become the new industry standard.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqJ1P0CVNGw

author: {'steamid': '76561197992462465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1522455683}
review:
Just completed my first mission - the tugboat.  I'm on a purpose built computer running Windows 7 64 bit, I3 2300 processor, 8 gb RAM, AMD Ratheon HD 6800 graphics card.  No problems running on "high" visuals setting.  Visuals, lighting, ambient sounds - all are great!   Looking forward to trying out the other missions and will update my review as needed.  I highly recommend this as an easy to play yet challenging game - great for relaxing with a cup of coffee and focusing on something other than work or school!

Recommendations I would have (with my short play time) - I liked that in the outer camera view the engine RPM's were shown.  It would be nice to have an indication if I had both throttles set evenly while in interior view.  It is difficult to ascertain (at least for me) just from their visual position.  Perhaps a small indicater either with a number equal either to how many "clicks" I've moved the throttle from zero, or an RPM indication?  Don't want to clutter up the screen though, so maybe another clickable icon along the side?  And I apologize if that's already in there, didn't find it!

Other than that, I agree with others who say some sort of career would make the game more in depth and focused.

All that being said - thoroughly enjoying this so far, and looking forward to getting some more time onboard!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015201346', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1426890102}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tbZih81ZCxM
Vorweg:
Ich spiele sonst keine Simulatoren. In den letzen Wochen wurde ich aber vermehrt dazu gen√∂tigt,deswegen gebe ich nun auch hier mal meine Meinung ab.

Vorreview:

Spiel ist noch in der Alpha. Die Macher bem√ºhen sich stetig um neues Material. Das Spiel nimmt Patch f√ºr Patch Gestalt an. Momentan gibt es ein paar Missionen. Von kleier Wassertaxi Mission bis hin zur F√§hman√∂ver mit viel Wasserverkehr.

Das Men√º ist noch sehr primitiv gehalten. Mir w√ºrde die jetzige Aufmachung auch im fertigem Spiel gen√ºgen.

Im letzen Patch wurde Wetter implementiert, ich bin sehr gespannt wie sich das Wetter auf hoher See verh√§lt und habe schon die eine oder andere virtuelle katastrophe geplant ;)

Nun gibt es auch mehr Archievments. Diese sind zwar noch nicht zu 100% fertiggestellt und im Spiel implementiert aber auch hier ist ein stetiger Fortschritt zu sehen.

Die Steuerung ingame ist sehr angenehm. Am einfachsten gestaltet sich die Sterung √ºber die Aussenansicht. F√ºr echte Kapit√§ne und solche die es werden wollen ist eine umfangreiche Innenansicht vorhanden. Hier muss noch eine Menge passieren. Die Grundsteuerung ist vorhanden und funktioniert. Hupe geht. Das wars auch schon.

Die Designs und grafiken sind wie gewohnt sehr liebevoll gestaltet und schrecken nicht vor l√§ngeren Spielsitzungen ab.

Da das Spiel sich noch in der Alpha befindet, werde ich meine Review hier St√ºck f√ºr ST√ºck vollenden. Aus diesem Grund vergebe ich auch noch keine Punkte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009960007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1551615570}
review:
Ok so here we have another Ship's Simulator.. But this time it seems the directors and staff are listening to the users and not blundering through

Yes if the Simulator is going to be maybe the best ever produced then they are off to a good start.   We Simulator buffs all know what we want so this time around you have the chance to say your bit.. Don't just bull on about unreal mods or patches. Think of the real world and persue the near real requirements, for this will surly become the Market leader for Shipping Simulators I think it's well on the way now!!

3rd Month of 2019 & still think this is a great Sim. But there's very little active input from the Dev's Be nice to have a few new mods, maybe to in_hance further.

Thank you for this great sim.

Please give us an open free world for sailing :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015168386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1424745976}
review:
I agree that European Ship Simulator (ESS) has amazing potential. The graphics are excellent, and it is a challenge to operate your ship right. Being a game in development, there are still some things to work on. Based on my limited experience with the game I do have some thoughts. See my comments in the suggestion forum.

My concern is that this game becomes just a mission oriented simulator. Driving the same ship, over the same course, at the same time of day, with the same weather, with the same AI ships in the same positions, with the same sea state‚Ä¶ you get the picture. It will quickly get put away and not played.

If it becomes a true simulator, with a purpose for my ship to leave the harbor, and ability to sail to multiple ports in a variety of conditions, then this sim will be fantastic.

I always thought: build it and they will come. Look what happened to MS Flight Simulator and Kerbal Space Program when they opened it up for developers to mod! Wow!! Both are sensational products. ESS has the same potential. Let‚Äôs see where it goes‚Ä¶.  It all depend on the budget and capabilities and desire of the producers.

For now I like what I see. 

Grandpa1955.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138970804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1552195479}
review:
Pretty darn good game so far.  I would say that if you are looking for a fast and furious action type simulation, this game isn't for you.  I you are looking for a realistic simulator designed to test your skills at navigating ships, then this is one to buy.  The graphics are good for an early release game and the physics of the ships seems pretty accurate.  I have owned boats most of my life and I would day that they control pretty much as I would think a ship would with the exception of the tug boat which seems a little overpowered.  The modeling of the water is incredible.  You really get the feeling that you are out on the ocean in the weather and waves.

Here is my wish list for this game:

The ability to visit different ports to pick up jobs instead of having the game be all mission based.

If the game is going to be mission based, include a mission builder to allow third party down loadable missions.

It would be nice to have the ability to walk around the entire vessel instead of being confined to the bridge.
Improved physics for the tug boat so that moving a large freighter isn't as easy as it seems now.

I look forward to the updates to see what the developers have in store for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044674305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1425323600}
review:
Hello There 

          This is my first review for European Ship Simulator and first of all I would like to congratulate the company and all the people responsible for creating this Simulator.Furthermore I must point out that the overall concept is very interesting and well captured,so lets get some things clear first of all I would like to mention that I am an Apprentice in the Merchant Navy and that I have been on board a Tanker ship and seen real Pilot Boats and Bulk carriers so I guess my giving this simulator a positive review might mean something to the designers,so to tell you the truth I am pleased that we (the people) finally see a Naval Simulator in the market where we can purchase at a reasonable price but at the same time very informative especially if you are interested in not just playing a game but experiencing a simulator.

       Keep up the great work and I would love to see this Simulator becoming a realistic and wonderful perhaps even educational and why not training programme for future merchant marine Academies at least for starters.I Am aware that this is not easy at all however this Simulator has the potential to become a very powerful and still very simple programme to use,enjoy and more importantly learn from.I can not wait to see what the future holds for this remarkable Simulator so do create more ships,improve the way larger ships behave in the water and add ports like Rotterdam,New York,San Fransisco the whole world would be great (perhaps in the form of updates from time to time like you do for Take On Mars).I like the sea behaviour and changes while in and out of the harbours and the Navigation Lights are incredibly detailed.I Did not like the fact that I am unable change the Graphics in more detail or change the weather conditions there is also no day/night change I hope that you will add these later on as the Simulator evolves.

     That's about it for the moment will write more Reviews soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965238899', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1548735535}
review:
Changing my position since the Early Access Review (read below). 

This simulator is still bare bones, and lots of bugs. It would be really fine if it was still under Early Access, but sadly it is not anymore. This is not the final product I was expecting. 

Here's an example, starting my tug mission at somewhat 13:00 hours, it should be bright outside. But it feels like dusk. The brightness and daylight is wrong. I start moving my tug to two ships that collided a few miles from my position. The movement of the ship in the water feels superficial, as there is no proper wake and although the bow wake seems fine, it still needs work. The water displacement, which you would expect from a couple of tons ship is barely noticeable. There is also water transparency missing.  A few other simulator and games have done a better job at wake too, like Total War: Rome 2, Deadliest Catch: Alaskan Storm, Silent Hunter Series, and even Spintires(The best water simulation and wake I've seen in a while).

Moving forward...
There is no depth radar, and only basic instrumentation. Reaching the two ships I receive the order to attach my tug boat to one of them. Sure, the line attached to my boat is also bugged, as in it doesn't look tied but like a big gigantic straight piece of rope glued to the ship. 

Moving on, a few minutes later a Coast Guard ship collides with the ship being towed. Showed no desire to slow down or deviate from the collision. In fact, it kept going even when it still collided to my towed ship. 

A few minutes later, my ship and the towed ship jumps around and I'm suddenly sinking! 

I hope the devs doesn't get dishearten over their product, because there are still a lot of love in it. Which I explained in my Early Access review. Like the texturing of the ships, the lights, and the water. But this is definitely not a finished product and I sadly CAN NOT recommend it as such. As an Early Access, sure, but not the way it is now. Buy it when it is on sale or when they fix this (which I will update this review accordingly if there are changes and if those changes are positive, I will recommend the simulator at a later stage)





__________________________________________________________
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW:

So far, the simulator seems to be scratching an itch that hasn't been scratched in ages. 
I love the attention to detail, and how they really bothered in making the ships. I love ferries but I fell in love with the fishing ship. Life huh! 

I also love the water, although I feel it needs a bit more love as in transparency (side of boats and docks and depth) refraction and reflection. But I would also love if we had proper ship wakes. A few games that managed to nail wakes, that I've seen are Silent Hunter 3/4/5, Deadliest Catch: Alaskan Storm(dynamic wakes) and Spintires(Dynamic wakes), and I would love to see that beautifully well-formed foam around the ship, giving a sense of movement, or that you are displacing tons of water.

And the developer's approach to the community and how they are handling criticism, suggestion and even the comments are very commendable. I think this simulator has shown a lot of promise, and I can't wait to see the developer‚Äôs dreams over this simulator come true. 

I also like how the light reflects over the surface of the ship, tiny things like that immerses you more than you can imagine. 


In other words, it is still Early Access, bare bones, probably pre-alpha, and still needs a lot of work, but what it already has is fun and worth the money! So, if you like simulation and ships, this is definitely something you should buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027089785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1430571201}
review:
At the current state, I can recommend this game only for die-hard ship simulator fans. For these people, it'll probably be like heaven. At first. Currently there are only a few missions to play but since this is an Early Access-game, it's totally understandable. Some missions have a time limit, if you exceed it by 1 second, it doesn't matter if you played for like.. 2 hours. Mission failed, that's all, plus an immediate return to the homescreen. The graphics are still quite buggy and unoptimized. But hey, it's Early Access.
 What really annoys me though is that the developer seems to focus on new content, not on bug fixes. And of course, it takes a loooot of time to create new content. Meanwhile you have a buggy game with a couple of missions, and perhaps every month a new mission. That is what I see here right now. CTDs are quite common, happens to me 70% of tries to play a mission, it crashes within the first 10 seconds. 
What I fear is that the game might become like the other ship simulators. Buggy, repetitive games with minimal content in terms of different things to do on the vessel.
Also, there are only the Steam Forums to communicate with the developer and well, I haven't seen him responding to any recommendations whatsoever on what to change in the game.
I think it is great that there's finally someone who wants to bring a new ship simulator to the market, but at the moment, I cannot recommend the average player to buy it, especially at this price. Wait a couple of months until major enhancements have (hopefully) been made so that you can see in which direction the game goes: the old Ship Simulator games or something new and really different.

// Update: 13.02.2015 - I was quite astonished when the developer announced that the game will leave early access next week, which means that it'll be on steam as an officially finished game. Although the developer said that they'll "continue to work" on it, I do not think that this is a good way for a game. It still has minimalistic content and is very unoptimized, containing disastrous bugs such as the horizon which is full of weird blue lines, flickering around and destroying the game's atmosphere. They have not been able to fix these for months. And how can you say that the game is finished when even the menus of some indie games made on unity look better than this one?

author: {'steamid': '76561197990368116', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1603640326}
review:
E' un bel gioco con una buona grafica. 
Rispetto al prodotto concorrente ha una fisica decisamente migliore ed anche la grafica oltre ad essere migliore √® anche meno "pesante" in termini di richieste di sistema.
Ma allo stato attuale offre poche  e brevi missioni . Inoltre come quasi tutti i giochi basati sul medesimo motore la gestione delle opzioni e dei controlli √® veramente pessima. L'aspetto migliore del progetto sembra essere il team di sviluppo che √® molto presente nei forum e che settimanalmente sta fornendo nuove missioni e migliorie. Se queste premesse saranno mantenute nel tempo ed i developer effettivamente continueranno lo sviluppo, potrebbe diventare il migliore tra i simulatori del genere. Ma ancora sicuramente non lo √®.
Vale il denaro richiesto? SI, se siete fan del genere. 
No se cercate un prodotto completo o se non siete disposti ad attendere il tempo necessaria a farlo uscire dallo stato di Early Access.

Voto allo stato attuale 6
Voto in base a quanto promette e sulla fiducia che i developer mi hanno trasmesso 8

author: {'steamid': '76561198093854278', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1459886837}
review:
This is a great sim to play! It is still in early-access but allready fun to play with. The developperteam is eager for feedback and they take all input seriously. 
You can sit in your gamechair and enjoy the high quality graphs while your ferry is cutting the waves in a bad wether situation.; very nice indeed. Trying to dock for the first time with a big ship, without damaging it, isn't easy, but you get to learn the how-to very quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004227954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1504817817}
review: As a current student at a Maritime Academy, I am really enjoying this game. It runs GREAT on my laptop and I hope the further development on this game strives. I hope this game will have a lot of new content in the future because I will be using it in my future to practice maneuvering. The game is very smooth and realistic other than the tug mission where you can slam a bulk carrier around with no consequences. Once again this is the best ship simulator that I have played since ship simulator extremes which is outdated and won‚Äôt run on my laptop. To the developers, keep up the good work and PLEASE add a container ship and maybe the ability to walk around the whole vessel not just the bridge. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065208375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1446664854}
review:
Hallo Allemaal,
mooie simulator, maar er moet nog veel aangebeuren , b.v  navigatie verlichting is niet helemaal juiste plaats bij bepaalde schepen, bv rood en groen licht zitten in de mast veel te hoog, heklicht moet zever mogelijk vanachter en bij grote zeeschepen moeten er 2 toplichten zijn, 1 achter zo hoog mogelijk en een voor ongeveer deze moet lager dan de achterste. moeten  terhoogte van de brug zijn.
Komt er later nog een mogelijkheid in om een joystick/stuurwiel enz aan te sluiten??
voor de rest ziet het er goed uit.
Gisteren bezig geweest met sommige missies, valt mij wel op dat de schade wel heel nipt is, had  90 % schade en zonk, normaal in het echt zal een schip echt niet zinken bij deze schade,  
ik denk dat er veel mensen zullen zijn vooral beginners die dit gauw beu zullen zijn.
Ook mis ik een mogelijk heid om vrij te varen zodat je eerst je schepen kan leren voor je aan de missies begint.

review: This game is in early access right now, but this is one of the few early access titles I can recommend without reservation. While there are only a few missions available in the game at this point, these missions are fun and appear to have all features. Also, the ships are very detailed and look great. Finally, the developer is releasing regular updates containing new missions and is thoughtfully interacting with the community. If you have any interest in ship simulators, I would recommend picking up this title to support a developer who is making a great effort to provide the community with a quality game.

review:
Upd 15'th july 2020, removed a snipped of the bottom.

[h1][b]Third Review - 14'th June 2019:[/b][/h1]
This game is still abandoned in 2019, there is no new missions and i expect the owners / devs to have fled as fast as they went in 2015 when it recieved no more updates, dont buy this game. This game was supposed to be a "free game" for those that bhought the "Ship Simulator Extremes" which was buggy as hell back in 2012 and abandoned to.. now this is abandoned.. This same menu, missions work and such but not much else.. Sad to see this game still as abandoned as ever when i re-visit it in 2019.. Really had my hopes high up for this one.

[h1][b]Second Review - 7'th December 2014:[/b][/h1]
Hi, now that ive played for more than a little while i will post something positive:
The good thing about this game is the graphics, the feeling and how you play it. It's really nice, but the sthing that puts it doewn is: It doesnt have free-roam, because its in early acces and the physics of other ships being towed behing your tug boat is very bad.

It's still in early access, but as of now i find this game really fun and challening! It's worth buying!

review: I really like this game.  It's a good start for an Early Access ship simming title.  The market needs one.  There were a few issues at the outset of it going live but from what I've seen in the updates and from the forum, the devs are working hard to  make this a great game as quickly as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998804899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1449102870}
review: I'm sad to say I don't think this was a well spent $20. I'm aware of the current state of the game and that it is a work in progress but I was so disappointed in the physics I had to write a review. Even the original Ship Simulator game made 8 years ago blows this one out of the water (not to mention the newer versions). The response of the vessels is unrealistic and when I saw the lines (rope) I was amazed at how strange it looked and jumped around.. Other than that, the graphics are good and I think there is potential here but the developer has got to get serious about this being a "simulator" and not just a game. Ship Sim set the standard and this just doesn't measure up...for now. I work on tugboats currently and I really want a good affordable simulator that does the maritime industry justice.

review: Alhough this is a Early Acsess title, it is very good right out of the gate. There aren't many missions and the options menu is sparse (to be polite) but the actual gameplay is fun and feels right. The interior views of the vessels are very well done and the water effects are some of the best I've seen recently. The game has it's problems such as horrendus FPS and a fair bit of stuttering and lag but for an imcomplete game, you get the feeling that the developers are moving in the right direction. Weekly content upgrades are a nice touch as is the developers engagment with thier customers. I really enjoy this sim and look forward to the "finished" version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056438915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1612660146}
review:
Hey,

I have installed European Ship Sim on a laptop Asus ROG G750JM with a GTX 860M and a i7 4710HQ CPU at 2.5 GHz and 3.2 when on turbo. I have also updated to the latest Nvidia drivers.  At first I had some troubles with starting a mission in ESS. But after an update was released I could complete a whole mission with no problem at all. All you need to do is update the game/sim in Steam to latest update released and it will/should work like a charm for every captain out there.


I really like that games like this one comes out as I am studying to watchkeeping officer for merchant ships in Finland at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983548320', 'num_games_owned': 3595, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1417412615}
review:
Below you'll find a video and written impression of the game
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTl8Gf5mP-s

European Ship Simulator is exactly as the name states, it is a simulation of what it's like to take control of a variety of European style ships. It's in early access so there is still a ways to go for this game but it does show some promise.

Graphically the game looks mostly top-notch. The interior of the ship's cabin are well detailed with high resolution textures and great quality models. You'll find all the small intricacies that you would in a real ship, switches, knobs, GPS, etc, which helps with immersion. The water and weather effects are also some great stuff as well. Though the ship's interior, and the ships them selves show some good quality, the game isn't 100% consistent at the moment. Some of the environmental models, such as buildings, the docks, and streets, are very low polygon and features low resolution textures. I'm hoping that these lacking elements in the visuals are just place holders until a later / final build. Audio wise I got no complaints as the sound effects are realistic with great background noises from the boat's motor and the sounds of the ocean itself keeping you company. 

As far as gameplay goes, It's surprisingly easy to learn and to get adjusted to, as the main controls is "WASD". Some ships will feature the option of more intricate controls with the num pad, allowing you to manipulate each of the ship's engines individually. Even at it's early stage, the game does a good job at simulating what it's like to drive a ship...for better or worst. I say this because, though the game achieves good results as a simulation, due to what it's simulating it may make it an incompatible for some gamers. Unlike Euro Truck Simulator, where you have the micromanagement of traffic, following traffic laws, avoiding cars, etc, European Ship Simulator is mostly "set sails to full" then auto-pilot straight. There will be lulls where you are simply doing nothing but watching the waves as you wait for your ship to arrive in a straight line to your destination. For enthusiast of simulation games or sailing, this won't be an issue, as that demographic probably already understand this before jumping in, but for the average gamer who is just curious to this game, know that this is a simulation before it's a game.

Currently at the time of this impression (version 633), there isn't much in the way of options, graphics, or audio, and there is only 4 missions available with no linking campaign or side features. This is early access I do understand, but at the same time I think it's fair to let people know that in it's current state, it is the bare minimum.

Overall, European Ship Simulator shows a lot of promise, that I think will shape up to be some thing quite interesting. But currently, it does feel rather unfinished. If you are a simulation game or ship/boat enthusiast, it might be worth your cash to check it out, even in it's early stages, but for every one else, keep an eye on it, but wait for later versions or even it's final release.

Pros:
- Mostly realistic and high quality visuals
- Feels realistic
- Varied amount of ships are enjoyable to cruise around in
- Shows promise of a bright future

Cons:
- Visual quality not 100% consistent
- Feels very incomplete currently (ver: 633)
- Subject matter might not be as universally appearling as Euro Truck Simulator

author: {'steamid': '76561198040222639', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1572943091}
review:
It's an ok start, but too early for being on sale. Criminally unstable and buggy, and I say that not because I don't expect an alpha game to be buggy, but it often makes to where 5% of my mission attempts actually let me finish a mission without crashing or locking up. There is also no save function(manual or automatic, so you will lose your progress.)
There is also effectively no settings menu. Low, Medium, and High and none of them seem to affect how the game looks. No vsync, reflections, distance, AA, nothing. 

The game certainly looks pretty, water reflections and physics are nice. Sitting inside the tug boat out in the ocean feels very realistic, however the actual buildings and cities a long the coast look like something from HotWheels Crash. It performs really well on my system, but that's something I'd expect, again looks nice, but not amazing. 

The game has nice sounds, the roar of the engines below and the horn on the ships all sound fitting, though that's mostly all you'll hear. That and seagulls for hours because the skip time function will probably break for you as well. 

Like I started with, it's a decent start, but under no circumstances would I suggest a casual player to purchase this. Only someone who is a big fan of ships and ocean simulators. Even then, they will probably go through all the content very quickly.

Launching February 2015 seems pretty soon, wait for launch before taking the dive off the starboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997326820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1448146187}
review:
Well, first things first, I just LOVE simulators like this. And the more life like they can be, the best they are. Non violent games where you can just relax for a few hours are rare. One or more things I would improve  or change are.

Damage is WAY to easy to get. I have been on fishing boats and ferries. They do not  sink by just touching the dock.
Weather should vary. And should be selectable.

Free movement camera. How come we cannot get out of the cabin?

Splash on the ship from waves and ship wake. Those are some of the most impressive effects that I look for in a ship sim. And when turnimg the prop flow should follow the rudder directio. after a small delay of course.

Towing cable......please fix those..... they are awful right now.

But at least frame rate is not choppy as in the other ship simulator, and it is at least playable. It has the potential to be great... PLEASE do not let it go as a mediocre game ...PLEASE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044276522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1447369248}
review:

Sulle prime ero indeciso, poi l'ho acquistato e devo dire che ho fatto un vero affare...

Per essere completo ci vorrebbe un bar di porto, marinai, una bottiglia di rum per poi andare a pescare a mezzanotto con mare in burrasca e pioggia battente....

author: {'steamid': '76561198095421784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1474124664}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067950675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1434902020}
review:
Positive: The graphic is great. The ships are beautiful and the water looks amazing. The landscape is also ok. Furthermore the ships are moving quite realistic! *You feel a bit like a captain*

Negative: At the moment the whole game is a bit bugged and about three minutes after starting the game it crashes.

All in all I recommend it because the animations are great and I hope that the bugs (especially the crash after three minutes) will be fixed soon.

Edit: 

Since the last update it isn't crashing anymore and now all graphics work very well! But it is still a bit laggy although i changed the graphic settings on "low" (but that is maybe my computer...).

I also made now some playing experiences: 

Positive: The animation of the ship, the water and the ports are great. You might think it is real. Furthermore the sounds are also very good.

Negative: In my eyes it is a bit too easy to sail the ship. All moves, like acceleration, breaking, turning and so on, are performed very fast by the ship (quite likeley that those movements are performed too fast for a big ship like the ferry). Furthermore the ferry mission is very easy; I don't even have to stand close to the port to finish the mission. It is enough to get close to the port with the back of the ship.

All in all, I keep recommending the game because the animations are awesome and I think/hope that there will be coming way more content in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030560324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1419271547}
review: 10/10 althought found the controls fickly looking great so far more missions

author: {'steamid': '76561197991435383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1520816778}
review:
I like the game. I have high hopes for it. I like the handling of the different vessels. The tug is fun to run. At first I did 360's and crashed into the dock. I have completed the 3 missions and felt like I was on a real boat. Almost could have got sea sick looking out the window of the tug. I know the sim is in the early stages but a list of things I'd like to see:
Map/mission editor, create my own waterway after a real port. Very important to me.
Multiplayer.
Create/edit  your own vessel.
Options to toggle on/off all audio or extras.
Put some real waves in there, look at bf4 they have some 25 foot waves which are a blast to run through.
On the minimap show other boats to scale.
Put in buoys, lights.
At this price and since it's not going to do anything but get better, I'd say get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089033777', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1520689882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067664887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1438857688}
review:
Update: August 2015

Devs have been eerily quite of the past few months. While the game is playable but it lacks depth in the missions with little more than different routes to sail. This game could be great but in its current state it's a little lack luster for a full released game.

-----

Really enjoying this simulator so far. Many simulations dissapoint but not this one. The developers want to create the best ship simulator and they are off to a flying start.

As of release there are just 3 missions allowing you to get inside the vessel and become a captain. Graphics are great, can you change views from inside and outside the vessel, gameplay is smooth, and no crashing or problems with the simulator.

If you like ETS2 you'll most likely enjoy this too!

Keep in mind this is currently in alpha so it's in early stages of development and not finshed. If you want all the bells and whistles of the sim then wait till development is complete.

Otherwise come on board and sail the seven seas!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKmiHiXQKtc

author: {'steamid': '76561198109434921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1481659993}
review:
Date 23/11/2014

Good game so far. nice graphic's feel's like  a more modern ship simulator extremes (graphic's wise)atm you get 3 missons on the dover -calisis route in good sailing conditions. other user's have reported crashes of the game i have had one crash but i guess these will be fixed in the future so i wouldn't worry about that. if enough money is given this game could be potentially very good.


what i hope they will incude in the future :

1. more routes across europe eg, hull to rotterdam and all across europe
2. money system to buy bigger, faster ferry's or updgade ship capacity on cargo ships
3. choice of sailing conditions.
4. route planning
5. auto docking (although this does take the best bit away so this should be optional)
6 live weather (this would be cool if they choose to put a route planner)
7. ships get unlocked at different xp start small and grow to bigger ships.

This list could go on forever so ill keep it at that. you should buy this game since it is only ¬£11.99 and help surpport this awsome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079107322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1439503485}
review:
Hmm, mixed thoughts about this:

Firstly some instructions might be nice!

Gave up on tug scenario as too hard without instructions as to how to control engines.

Moved onto ferry scenario = fared better but unable to dock in time after a couple of attempts.

So tried the Calais to Dover freight ship opton instead:

Enjoyed this more as no time limit and had time to explore steering options.

One of the world's busiest shipping lanes was scarily devoid of other traffic!

Slightly lost my bearings half way across Channel - better maps needed?

Then just sank for no obvious reason which really annoyed me! Was doing a reasonable 14 knots in lumpy sea with no prior damage to ship!

Pretty slow framerate when another ship passed me in Dover = given I have decent computer and graphics card.

Looks promising - so long as additional ports and ships are added to initial release for free and not some exhorbintanly priced DLC!

Also note that there is no option to save game in present release - have to play till you 'timeout' or sink (for no reason) in my case!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020633522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1447774136}
review:
It can be great game but path of ships and sinking ship need improve. It is very irritating now. 

In third mission at destination is small ship which enter port on one side then sail through port to oposite side where leave and then return to starting position. I stopped my ship far away from port and waited until small ship leave port and i will have free way to dock. It was mistake because small ship was heading directly to me and was too close when i recognize small ship. Sinking large ship after collision with that small ship is crazy and if i know it's  task for smaller ship to dodge. Because i was on place without any move for few minutes i must presume it was some sort of terrorist attack which is implemented alredy...

author: {'steamid': '76561198099789164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1645569885}
review: Since the latest update fixing the integrated graphics card bug, I can finally enjoy this game. Graphics are OK, modeling boat also. Small some bugs but I think there will be solved by next update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025116928', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1430586494}
review:
I had no real problems. The third scenario (bulk carrier) from Calais to Dover was slightly difficult to find the right position for the scenario to end, but I did it in the end.

Gameplay is really good; at the moment it's more about manouvering your ship around port, as you can skip the bits at sea. Would be nice to see some traffic on the channel since as well as being one of the busiest sea lanes in the world, it is meant to be quite challenging to cross with traffic coming from all directions. I'm sure things like this will come in time though.

Some tips:
The green arrow on the map points at where you need to go, not the direction of the ship (which is the black underneath). You can hit 'P' to get a waypoint marker, but it's usually off-map, and the green arrow is less obtrusive.

Learn the keys - they aren't that complicated (basically WASD and keypad) and it makes it much easier to control the ship precisely.

When you do the tug mission, click 'T' produces some markers on your boat. You then need to drag a line to the vesselyou are towing to connect a line. Don't make it too short like I did, otherwise you end up pulling the front of the vessel down as you tow it :-) You can also push with the tug boat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972451986', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1429168051}
review:
Well the Early Access is here for European Ship Simulator, I must admit I have been waiting for this one.
So far I've not experienced any issues launching the game or with game performance although I am aware others have reported, please keep in mind you are buying into a game that is in development and you may find issues along the way

You can check out my first experience with this title here (http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=344921077)  as i attempt to pilot the Ferry from Dover to Calais...how hard can it be right!?

This game has a very solid set of game mechanics from the helm controls to the handling of the ships, all have a feeling of authenticity that I hope will be built upon with the continued development. 

Good points:
Graphics and modeling are good 
The audio for both ship effects and ambient sound is good.
Game mechanics (controls/ship handling/other craft) is good
Weather effects are impressive.
An enjoyable & rewarding experience  

Need to work on (would like to see added):
A Tutorial to introduce the player to the controls etc
More ships and tasks to complete (I realize this is Early access so this will be in development)
The game mechanic to transport deliveries (goods or people) from port to port
Maybe a management aspect to build a shipping company up
AI crew on the bridge (its a little bit lonely as the captain)
The time skip button didn't seem to work for me 
More options in the graphics settings etc 

The game looks like it has a great deal of potential and I look forward to seeing the development and evolution of this game. This is an Early access so the options are a little limited but so far it has a very solid base to build from. This could be a cracking little game!

Taff

Taff In Exile

author: {'steamid': '76561198029197348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1434666689}
review:
Been playing this game for a while now, mostly on my way to work. Works great on my laptop despite it not being intended for gaming. Having played most if not all ship simulators presently on the market, this is among my favourites. While it may have its problems at times due to it being n Early Access, the team behind it are dedicated to creating a brilliant simulator and clearly have the skills required to do it.

Something that really immersed me was the way you can see the bow of the ship lifting as you pass over waves. The immersiveness of the bridge is something I've been waiting for, as previous simulation games of this type did not create a realistic feeling to me.

The texture work, especially when in free walk mode, is something you should take the time to look at. It may be a little boring to sit and stare at a wall, but if you do, you'll see the amount of detail this game has already.

All in all from what I've seen of this game so far, it's primed to be an excellent title that many simulation fans will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970488923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1424869728}
review:
Having built my YouTube channel around simulation titles I was eagerly awaiting European Ship Simulator from Excalibur Publishing. Now that early access is here with three missions to play I must say the wait was worth it. From the graphics to the physics of the ships to the ambient sounds makes this title very enjoyable so far.

As will all early access games there will be some glitches that appear in the game and the devs encourage reporting these as they happen to help remove them from the final product.

I preview the Tug Boat mission on a Lets Play and really enjoyed the mission. There could be some minor tweaks on the ropes that connect to the ships that you are tasked to tug and  I am sure that the devs will continue to strive to perfect this game.

Overall this game has so much potential and I encourage anyone who enjoys simulator games to give this a try- you wont be disappointed in my opinion. I salute the Devs and Excalibur on a very successful start so far!

[h1]Akiic ToDaHead[/h1]
[h1]Casual Games[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039088716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1418922282}
review:
Bravo, not a bad simulator, great physics and great graphics, i would even say this is too good for alpha stage except obviously the content.

Only gripe is that i wish the ship was more controlable like starting and stoping the engine, controlling most of the switches and of course real working monitor screens.

Well done guys with a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012412076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1440534402}
review: Hello Everybody! i played European Ship simulator even with a malfunctioning hardware and the game has got me it is very much more realistic then Ship Simulator Extreme the game is still very young so before saing bad review about it let it grow this game is very immersive as my self worked on a ferry before thereis some step missing but it's no bigdeal because the company will add them eventually  the game as its strong and weak points the strong point are the game look beautiful very beautiful and the boats handle very easely! we also have realistic physics but even though that it need works! it is still awesome how well the ship react to the waves! the bag point of it is only 3 mission!! but no worry! the team will add them weekly! the game still has some bugs! and missing things but you guys gotta understand that they are only 5 people working on this game in SSE they were a dozen 20 people worked on it and they couln,t even get us something as realistic as this european ship simulator is about to give us! for everyone that love ships and nautical navigation then look no further with this game you'll get AWESOME stuff also! each week there will be a ship a mission or a port added depending on what they focus and ofcourse! a new patch that will correct bugs and will add some new things around! i have alot of faith on this game because this game is what gonna reborn the simulation as it was with flight simulator ! also you guys will be able to make your own ship on the workshop that is awesome so people can make great ships! for the game environnement also created your own mission with a mission editor you can also send the mission on the workshop :) so this is the perfect simulator of the sea! even though it still need alot of work BUT GUYS COME ON this is a early access the game is far from finish so i encourage everyone to support the team so we can togheter make the best ship simulator around steam! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198121915435', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1425738422}
review:
I enjoy this game alot. It is just one of the best ship simulators in the gaming industry, even though it's within hours of it's first release, I can tell that this is going to go well. I think if you love Ship Simulators, you should get this. 

Pros:
*Very realistic water physics
*Detailed Ships
*Very detailed Bridges
*Tugboat Physicis
*Realistic Weather
*Wipers on Bridge window that WORKS
*Mission Editor
*20 Missions

Cons:
*Tugboat line gets messed up when you tow a ship


EDIT: Removed one Con. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040101450', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1563454420}
review:
I can say that the game looks very promising and has a lot of potential. Graphics are fine (especially water animations), sound is realistic (great horn and weather sounds) and the game runs smooth in general. I also like the option of skipping to next port. Then there is a ton of features I would like to see in the future. Things like leaving the bridge and exploring the whole ship, being able to zoom in from the first person view, more camera options and functional lifeboats. The damage system is not so great either. My ship sunk in a few seconds after colliding with a small vessel.  I'm waiting for the upcoming updates and patches. Keep up the good work :D
_____________________
Update

Developers abandoned this project and no longer support it. Game is broken and crashes frequently. Many players are unable to start the game at all. DO NOT BUY!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996719241', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1429464173}
review:
This looks promising! You can see there's been a lot of thought and detail put in so far. You can control your ship via keyboard or just using the mouse to handle the levers and switches yourself. Being able to walk around the bridge is awesome too. You get a nice sense of scale when captaining a large ferry that I really enjoy. 

You're currently limited to 3 missions, which is understandable given it's Early Access, each with a different boat and in different conditions. Involving both Dover and Calais. I take this route a lot and can say attention has been made towards the skylines of both these towns and ports, which again is a nice touch. 

You can even sink the ship and stand on the bridge as you witness the area filling with water, if that's something you're into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029579382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1417182868}
review:
Looks great especially water lots of seagulls also handles life like internal camera looked really nice, there is not alot to do but i knew that before i purchased, this game has great potential if it stays on current path.

I will follow this game and see how it pans out if your into the whole shipping aspect this game is for you so grab a copy and help the developer build the ocean version of ETS2.

Only suggestion more detailed graphics selection, also the only resolution is native resolution so for me i had no choice but to play on 5760x1080 but the game ran perfect at this resolution, but i do think there should be option for this in game.

Reel Big Kris does have a working suggstion in my comments also check out community hub for sticky post

Looking foward to future updates and will adjust this when needed
